12.7mm CHAC Ammo Box.name: 12.7mm CHAC Ammo Box
12.7mm CHAC Ammo Box.description: The 12.7mm CHAC Ammo Box provides 25 12.7mm CHAC Rounds of Sniper Ammunition that works with the Anti-materiel Rifle .

12.7mm CHAC Explosive Ammo Box.name: 12.7mm CHAC Explosive Ammo Box
12.7mm CHAC Explosive Ammo Box.description: The 12.7mm CHAC Explosive Ammo Box provides 25 12.7mm CHAC Explosive Rounds of Sniper Ammunition that works with the Anti-materiel Rifle .

12.7mm CHAC Explosive Round.name: 12.7mm CHAC Explosive Round
12.7mm CHAC Explosive Round.description: 12.7mm CHAC Explosive Round is a type of explosive Sniper Ammunition for the Anti-materiel Rifle that does 500 projectile damage and 400 explosive damage.

12.7mm CHAC Incendiary Ammo Box.name: 12.7mm CHAC Incendiary Ammo Box
12.7mm CHAC Incendiary Ammo Box.description: The 12.7mm CHAC Incendiary Ammo Box provides 25 12.7mm CHAC Incendiary Rounds of Sniper Ammunition that works with the Anti-materiel Rifle .

12.7mm CHAC Incendiary Round.name: 12.7mm CHAC Incendiary Round
12.7mm CHAC Incendiary Round.description: 12.7mm CHAC Incendiary Round is a type of explosive Sniper Ammunition for the Anti-materiel Rifle that does 500 projectile damage and +25% fire damage.

12.7mm CHAC Round.name: 12.7mm CHAC Round
12.7mm CHAC Round.description: 12.7mm CHAC Round is a type of Sniper Ammunition for the Anti-materiel Rifle that does 600 damage.

12-Gauge Buckshot Shell.name: 12-Gauge Buckshot Shell
12-Gauge Buckshot Shell.description: 12-Gauge Buckshot Shell, the basic ammunition used by Shotguns . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts, this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered.

12-Gauge CHAC Shell.name: 12-Gauge CHAC Shell
12-Gauge CHAC Shell.description: 12-Gauge CHAC Shell is an advanced purchaseable buckshot ammunition that does up to 450 damage. It pairs well with the CHAC "Boomstick" Shotgun that can also be purchased from the Workshop .

12-Gauge CHAC Shell Box.name: 12-Gauge CHAC Shell Box
12-Gauge CHAC Shell Box.description: The 12-Gauge CHAC Shell Box provides 25 rounds of the 12-Gauge CHAC Shell that works with any Shotgun and pairs well with the CHAC "Boomstick" Shotgun that can also be purchased from the Workshop .

12-Gauge Cold Steel Shell.name: 12-Gauge Cold Steel Shell
12-Gauge Cold Steel Shell.description: 12-Gauge Cold Steel Shell is a Cold Steel variant of ammunition for Shotguns . It inflicts extra Frost damage and a chance to slow the target and weaken their attacks.

12-Gauge Explosive Shell.name: 12-Gauge Explosive Shell
12-Gauge Explosive Shell.description: 12-Gauge Explosive Shells are used by Shotguns . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered. Damages area around target. Caution when using this ammunition is advised. 12-Gauge Explosive Shells have 6 pellets per shell.

12-Gauge Miasmic Shell.name: 12-Gauge Miasmic Shell
12-Gauge Miasmic Shell.description: 12-Gauge Miasmic Shell, a Miasmic variant of ammunition used by Shotguns .

12-Gauge Obsidian Shell.name: 12-Gauge Obsidian Shell
12-Gauge Obsidian Shell.description: 12-Gauge Obsidian Shells are a variant of 12-Gauge Buckshot Shells that deal fire damage on hit and have a chance to apply a unique debuff to targets while also setting them ablaze. Although it may have a low percent chance of setting targets on fire, 12-Gauge Obsidian Shells can decimate Fauna that have a weakness to fire, especially when the 'Burning' modifier occurs. .

5.56mm Armor Piercing Round.name: 5.56mm Armor Piercing Round
5.56mm Armor Piercing Round.description: 5.56mm Armor Piercing Round is used by the Assault Rifle .

5.56mm Cold Steel Round.name: 5.56mm Cold Steel Round
5.56mm Cold Steel Round.description: 5.56mm Cold Steel Round is a Cold Steel variant of ammunition for the Assault Rifle . It inflicts extra Frost damage and a chance to slow the target and weaken their attacks.

5.56mm Explosive Round.name: 5.56mm Explosive Round
5.56mm Explosive Round.description: The 5.56mm Explosive Round is used by the Assault Rifle . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered. Damages area around target. Caution when using this ammunition is advised.

5.56mm Incendiary Round.name: 5.56mm Incendiary Round
5.56mm Incendiary Round.description: The 5.56mm Incendiary Rounds are used in the fully-automatic Tier 4  Assault Rifle . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered.

5.56mm Miasmic Round.name: 5.56mm Miasmic Round
5.56mm Miasmic Round.description: 5.56mm Miasmic Round, a Miasmic variant of ammunition used by the Assault Rifle .

5.56mm Obsidian Round.name: 5.56mm Obsidian Round
5.56mm Obsidian Round.description: 5.56mm Obsidian Rounds are an alternative to 5.56mm Incendiary Rounds that deal fire damage on hit and has a chance to apply a unique debuff to targets while also setting them ablaze. Although it may have a low percent chance of setting targets on fire, 5.56mm Obsidian Rounds excel when used against Fauna that have a weakness to fire, dealing more damage than 5.56mm Rounds . .

5.56mm Round.name: 5.56mm Round
5.56mm Round.description: The 5.56mm Rounds are used in the fully-automatic Tier 4  Assault Rifle . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered.

7.62mm Armor Piercing Round.name: 7.62mm Armor Piercing Round
7.62mm Armor Piercing Round.description: 7.62mm Armor Piercing Rounds are used by the Bolt Action Rifle and the Hunting Rifle . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered. Unlike standard ammunition, the 7.62mm Armor Piercing Round can pierce hardened points and will deal 250 damage, similar to hitting a non-hardened point.

7.62mm CHAC Ammo Box.name: 7.62mm CHAC Ammo Box
7.62mm CHAC Ammo Box.description: The 7.62mm CHAC Ammo Box provides 25 7.62mm CHAC Rounds of Rifle Ammunition that works with Rifles .

7.62mm CHAC Round.name: 7.62mm CHAC Round
7.62mm CHAC Round.description: 7.62mm CHAC Round is a purchaseable type of Rifle Ammunition for use in any Rifle .

7.62mm Cold Steel Round.name: 7.62mm Cold Steel Round
7.62mm Cold Steel Round.description: 7.62mm Cold Steel Round is a Cold Steel variant of ammunition for Rifles . It inflicts extra Frost damage and a chance to slow the target and weaken their attacks.

7.62mm Explosive Round.name: 7.62mm Explosive Round
7.62mm Explosive Round.description: 7.62mm Explosive Rounds are used by the Bolt Action Rifle and the Hunting Rifle . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered. Damages area around target. Caution when using this ammunition is advised.

7.62mm Incendiary Round.name: 7.62mm Incendiary Round
7.62mm Incendiary Round.description: 7.62mm Incendiary Rounds are used by the Bolt Action Rifle / Hunting Rifle . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered. Hitting a target will set it ablaze, dealing damage for approximately 20 seconds. Deals 8-11 damage a second to normal targets, and 16-22 damage a second to targets that are weak to fire..

7.62mm Miasmic Round.name: 7.62mm Miasmic Round
7.62mm Miasmic Round.description: 7.62mm Miasmic Round, a Miasmic variant of ammunition used by Rifles .

7.62mm Obsidian Round.name: 7.62mm Obsidian Round
7.62mm Obsidian Round.description: 7.62mm Obsidian Rounds are an alternative to 7.62mm Incendiary Rounds that deals fire damage on hit and has a chance to apply a unique debuff to targets while also setting them ablaze. Although it may have a low percent chance of setting targets on fire, 7.62mm Obsidian Rounds excel when used against Fauna that have a weakness to fire, dealing more damage than 7.62mm Rounds . .

9mm Armor Piercing Round.name: 9mm Armor Piercing Round
9mm Armor Piercing Round.description: 9mm Armor Piercing Rounds are used by the Pistol . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered. Unlike standard ammunition, the 9mm Armor Piercing Round can pierce hardened points and will deal 100 damage, similar to hitting a non-hardened point.

9mm CHAC Ammo.name: 9mm CHAC Ammo
9mm CHAC Ammo.description: 9mm CHAC Ammo is an advanced pistol ammunition that does 200 damage.

9mm CHAC Ammo Box.name: 9mm CHAC Ammo Box
9mm CHAC Ammo Box.description: The 9mm CHAC Ammo Box provides 25 rounds of 9mm CHAC Ammo that works with any Pistol and pairs well with the CHAC "Sentinel" Pistol that can also be purchased from the Workshop .

9mm Cold Steel Round.name: 9mm Cold Steel Round
9mm Cold Steel Round.description: 9mm Cold Steel Round is a Cold Steel variant of ammunition for Pistols . It inflicts extra Frost damage and a chance to slow the target and weaken their attacks.

9mm Explosive Round.name: 9mm Explosive Round
9mm Explosive Round.description: 9mm Explosive Rounds are used by the Pistol . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered. Damages area around target. Caution when using this ammunition is advised.

9mm Incendiary Round.name: 9mm Incendiary Round
9mm Incendiary Round.description: 9mm Incendiary Rounds are used by the Pistol . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered. Hitting a target will set it ablaze, dealing damage for approximately 20 seconds. Deals 8-11 damage a second to normal targets, and 16-22 damage a second to targets that are weak to fire. .

9mm Miasmic Round.name: 9mm Miasmic Round
9mm Miasmic Round.description: 9mm Miasmic Round, a Miasmic variant of ammunition used by Pistols .

9mm Obsidian Round.name: 9mm Obsidian Round
9mm Obsidian Round.description: 9mm Obsidian Rounds are an alternative to 9mm Incendiary Rounds that deals fire damage on hit and has a chance to apply a unique debuff to targets while also setting them ablaze. Although it may have a low percent chance of setting targets on fire, 9mm Obsidian Rounds excel when used against Fauna that have a weakness to fire, dealing more damage than 9mm Rounds . .

9mm Round.name: 9mm Round
9mm Round.description: The basic ammunition used by the Pistols . Unlike arrows, javelins, and bolts this ammunition is destroyed on impact and cannot be recovered. With the talent Pistol Proficiency , Prospectors can craft this ammo at a -25% reduced resource cost. Also, with the talent Freebies , Prospectors have a 5% chance to craft double ammo. The ability to craft double ammo works in tandem, on a successful proc chance, with the reduced resource cost recipe netting a total of six extra rounds of ammunition.

Aluminium Arrow.name: Aluminium Arrow
Aluminium Arrow.description: The Aluminium Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 5.

Ammo Casing.name: Ammo Casing
Ammo Casing.description: The Ammo Casing is a vital component used in the crafting of 9mm Rounds and 7.62mm Rounds .

Black Wolf Arrow.name: Black Wolf Arrow
Black Wolf Arrow.description: The Black Wolf Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 10.

Bone Arrow.name: Bone Arrow
Bone Arrow.description: The Bone Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass.

Carbon Arrow.name: Carbon Arrow
Carbon Arrow.description: The Carbon Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 5.

Carbon Fibre Round Shield.name: Carbon Fibre Round Shield
Carbon Fibre Round Shield.description: The Carbon Fibre Round Shield is crafted at the Forge/Foundry with the following resources:

Carved Wood Narrow Wardrobe.name: Carved Wood Narrow Wardrobe
Carved Wood Narrow Wardrobe.description: Carved Wood Narrow Wardrobe is a decorative narrow wardrobe with 10 inventory slots. It has two build variants available by selecting 'R' when deploying.

Caveworm Arrow.name: Caveworm Arrow
Caveworm Arrow.description: The Caveworm Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Similar to the Poison Arrow , these are helpful in a 'fire and flee' situation. Firing multiple arrows will continue to stack the Poisoned debuff, dealing damage over time.

Cold Steel Arrow.name: Cold Steel Arrow
Cold Steel Arrow.description: The Cold Steel Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow , introduced in Chapter - New Frontier . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 5.

Columbian Mammoth Trophy.name: Columbian Mammoth Trophy
Columbian Mammoth Trophy.description: Columbian Mammoth Trophies are decorative deployables that can be placed on any wall surface and are used to liven any living space. Aside from helping prospectors complete the Bestiary , it can also be used in tandem with other Furniture to increase the Coziness of your living quarters, increasing the duration and effectiveness of the Well Rested Buff .

Columbian Mammoth Vestige.name: Columbian Mammoth Vestige
Columbian Mammoth Vestige.description: Columbian Mammoth Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Columbian Mammoth Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Composite Arrow.name: Composite Arrow
Composite Arrow.description: The Composite Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 5.

Crude Ammo.name: Crude Ammo
Crude Ammo.description: Crude Ammo is a crude, low-tech ammunition that works with all categories of Pistols .

Decorative Shell.name: Decorative Shell
Decorative Shell.description: The Decorative Shell is an item unlocked by completing the Fracture mission. There are two varieties of pottery selectable by 'R'.

Fire Arrow.name: Fire Arrow
Fire Arrow.description: Want to turn that forest filled with bears into an inferno? The fire arrow is your friend. Need a light at the top of that cave? Fire arrow. While not as bright as the Flare Arrow , it will continue burning upon impact. Similar to the Poison Arrow , the Fire Arrow is a DOT upgrade to the Stone Arrow , which is helpful when in a 'fire and flee' situation. These arrows cannot be recovered once fired.

Flare Arrow.name: Flare Arrow
Flare Arrow.description: Flare Arrows are used to light up dark areas/cave roofs and can be shot high into the air to illuminate the darkness or to signal fellow Prospectors from a distance. These arrows cannot be recovered once fired.

Flint Arrow.name: Flint Arrow
Flint Arrow.description: The Flint Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 5.

Inaris \"Aruda\" Arrow.name: Inaris "Aruda" Arrow
Inaris \"Aruda\" Arrow.description: The Inaris "Aruda" Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass.

Inaris \"Aruda\" Arrow Bundle.name: Inaris "Aruda" Arrow Bundle
Inaris \"Aruda\" Arrow Bundle.description: Consuming the Inaris "Aruda" Arrow Bundle will add 25x Inaris "Aruda" Arrow s to the Prospectors inventory, must be consumed after dropping into a prospect. Consumed arrow bundles cannot be taken back to the space station. Arrow bundles that have not been consumed can be taken back to the space station for use in another prospect.

Inaris \"Biana\" Arrow.name: Inaris "Biana" Arrow
Inaris \"Biana\" Arrow.description: The Inaris "Biana" Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. The elemental damage dealt by these arrows are not effected by Bow talents.

Inaris \"Biana\" Arrow Bundle.description: Consuming the Inaris "Biana" Arrow Bundle will add 25x Inaris "Biana" Arrow s to the Prospectors inventory, must be consumed after dropping into a Prospect. Larkwell Martinez Ballistic Arrow.name: Larkwell Martinez Ballistic Arrow
Larkwell Martinez Ballistic Arrow.description: The Larkwell Martinez Ballistic Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Unlike bolts and javelins, they cannot be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Caution when using this ammunition is advised.

Larkwell Tazer Arrow Bundle.description: Consuming the Larkwell Tazer Arrow Bundle will add 25x Larkwell Martinez Tazer Arrow s to the Prospectors inventory, must be consumed after dropping into a prospect. Mammoth Tusk.name: Mammoth Tusk
Mammoth Tusk.description: Mammoth Tusks are a resource obtained from the Woolly Mammoth / Columbian Mammoth . Requires an Iron Knife or better to skin and harvest the downed beast.

Miasmic Arrow.name: Miasmic Arrow
Miasmic Arrow.description: The Miasmic Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow , requiring Distilled Miasmic Coating introduced on the Prometheus map.

MXC Flange Arrow.name: MXC Flange Arrow
MXC Flange Arrow.description: The MXC Flange Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass.

MXC Flange Arrow Bundle.description: Consuming the bundle will add 5x MXC Flange Arrow to the Prospectors inventory, must be consumed after dropping into a prospect. Consumed arrow bundles cannot be taken back to the space station. Arrow bundles that have not been consumed can be taken back to the space station for use in another prospect.

MXC Nerve Arrow.name: MXC Nerve Arrow

Consumed arrow bundles cannot be taken back to the space station. Arrow bundles that have not been consumed can be taken back to the space station for use in another prospect.

Narrow Barrel Attachment.name: Narrow Barrel Attachment
Narrow Barrel Attachment.description: Narrow Barrel Attachment is a mid-to-end game item available once the prospector has unlocked the Ranged Attachment Pack tech.

Obsidian Arrow.name: Obsidian Arrow
Obsidian Arrow.description: The Obsidian Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 5.

Poison Arrow.name: Poison Arrow
Poison Arrow.description: The Poison Arrow is a damage over time upgrade to the Stone Arrow , which is helpful when in a 'fire and flee' situation. DOT effect stacks.

Round Rustic Sign.name: Round Rustic Sign
Round Rustic Sign.description: A Round Rustic Sign made of wood.

Rustic Narrow Wardrobe.name: Rustic Narrow Wardrobe
Rustic Narrow Wardrobe.description: The Rustic Narrow Wardrobe smaller wardrobe but still has 10 slot capacity and two variations selectable by holding R.

Sandworm Arrow.name: Sandworm Arrow
Sandworm Arrow.description: An upgrade to the Poison Arrow these are helpful in a 'fire and flee' situation. Firing multiple arrows will continue to stack the Wound debuff, decreasing health regeneration of the target by 80%.

Shengong \"Wenhe\" Arrow.name: Shengong "Wenhe" Arrow
Shengong \"Wenhe\" Arrow.description: The Shengong "Wenhe" Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass.

Shengong \"Wenhe\" Arrow Bundle.description: Consuming the Shengong "Wenhe" Arrow Bundle will add 25x Shengong "Wenhe" Arrows to the Prospectors inventory, must be consumed after dropping into a prospect. Consumed arrow bundles cannot be taken back to the space station. Arrow bundles that have not been consumed can be taken back to the space station for use in another prospect.

Steel Arrow.description: The Steel Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 5.

Stone Arrow.name: Stone Arrow
Stone Arrow.description: The Stone Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass.

Titanium Arrow.name: Titanium Arrow
Titanium Arrow.description: The Titanium Arrow is ammunition used with a Bow . Like bolts and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 5.

Woolly Mammoth Trophy.name: Woolly Mammoth Trophy
Woolly Mammoth Trophy.description: Woolly Mammoth Trophies are decorative deployables that can be placed on any wall surface and are used to liven any living space. Aside from helping prospectors complete the Bestiary , it can also be used in tandem with other Furniture to increase the Coziness of your living quarters, increasing the duration and effectiveness of the Well Rested Buff .

Woolly Mammoth Vestige.description: Woolly Mammoth Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Mammoth Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Alpha Wolf Vestige.name: Alpha Wolf Vestige
Alpha Wolf Vestige.description: Alpha Wolf Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create an Alpha Wolf Trophy , which can help help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Antelope Vestige.name: Antelope Vestige
Antelope Vestige.description: Antelope Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create an Antelope Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Arctic Arm Armor.name: Arctic Arm Armor
Arctic Arm Armor.description: Arctic Armor is a major upgrade to Fur Armor , offering unrivaled cold resistance.
Arctic Arm Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Arctic Feet Armor.name: Arctic Feet Armor
Arctic Feet Armor.description: Arctic Armor is a major upgrade to Fur Armor , offering unrivaled cold resistance.
Arctic Feet Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Arctic Head Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Arctic Scorpion Vestige.name: Arctic Scorpion Vestige
Arctic Scorpion Vestige.description: Arctic Scorpion Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create an Arctic Scorpion Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Arctic Vesper Vestige.name: Arctic Vesper Vestige
Arctic Vesper Vestige.description: Arctic Vesper Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Arctic Vesper Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary . The trophy can serve as a decoration providing Coziness .

Arid Striker Vestige.name: Arid Striker Vestige
Arid Striker Vestige.description: Arid Striker Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create an Arid Striker Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Armored Saddle.name: Armored Saddle
Armored Saddle.description: The Armored Saddle is a saddle for Mounts that has a medieval aesthetic. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC and is a cosmetic change to the Basic Riding Saddle that provides no additional attributes.

Armor Attachment Pack.name: Armor Attachment Pack
Armor Attachment Pack.description: Armor Attachment Pack is a Tier 3  Tech needed for the Alteration Bench that allows Prospectors to alter their armor pieces with Attachment Packs .

Ashen Drake Vestige.name: Ashen Drake Vestige
Ashen Drake Vestige.description: Ashen Drake Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create an Ashen Drake Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Bear Vestige.name: Bear Vestige
Bear Vestige.description: Bear Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Bear Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary . They are also used at the Advanced Textiles Bench / Electric Textiles Bench to make Bear Rugs . Decorative purposes aside, both provide a boost to coziness, which increases the duration and effect of the Well Rested Buff .

Black Jaguar Vestige.name: Black Jaguar Vestige
Black Jaguar Vestige.description: Black Jaguar Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Black Jaguar Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Blueback Vestige.name: Blueback Vestige
Blueback Vestige.description: Blueback Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Blueback Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Bone Arm Armor.name: Bone Arm Armor
Bone Arm Armor.description: Bone Armor provides relatively good protection from Icarus' fauna as a Tier 1  armor with a minor boost to temperature resistance. Also provides a considerable damage increase when a full set is worn.

Bone Feet Armor.name: Bone Feet Armor

First Cohort Envirosuit.name: First Cohort Envirosuit
First Cohort Envirosuit.description: As part of the ICARUS: Supporters Edition (unavailable for purchase), prospectors received an exclusive UDA envirosuit with a built-in water slot – giving an edge to prospectors who dare pursue fortune on the moon's surface. There’s no better way to show your commitment than to wear it with pride. The First Cohort Envirosuit is researched and crafted in the Workshop on the Space Station .

Shengong \"Dongtian\" Envirosuit.description: The Shengong "Dongtian" Envirosuit is purchased in the Workshop on the Space Station .

Snow Leopard Vestige.name: Snow Leopard Vestige
Snow Leopard Vestige.description: Snow Leopard Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Snow Leopard Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary . They are also used at the Advanced Textiles Bench / Electric Textiles Bench to make Snow Leopard Rugs . Decorative purposes aside, both provide a boost to coziness, which increases the duration and effect of the Well Rested Buff .

Snow Rabbit Vestige.name: Snow Rabbit Vestige
Snow Rabbit Vestige.description: Snow Rabbit Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Snow Rabbit Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Snow Stalker Vestige.name: Snow Stalker Vestige
Snow Stalker Vestige.description: Snow Stalker Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Snow Stalker Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Snow Wolf Vestige.name: Snow Wolf Vestige
Snow Wolf Vestige.description: Snow Wolf Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Snow Wolf Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary . They are also used at any textiles bench to make Snow Wolf Rugs . Decorative purposes aside, both provide a boost to coziness, which increases the duration and effect of the Well Rested Buff .

Stonejaw Vestige.name: Stonejaw Vestige
Stonejaw Vestige.description: Stonejaw Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Stonejaw Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Stryder Vestige.name: Stryder Vestige
Stryder Vestige.description: Stryder Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Stryder Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Suit Conditioning Module.name: Suit Conditioning Module
Suit Conditioning Module.description: This module increases the user's resistance to cold/hot environments, reducing the chances of Hypothermia/Hyperthermia. It can be researched and crafted on the Space Station in the Workshop . Multiple Suit Conditioning Modules may be equipped if the Prospector has available slots on their Envirosuit and will further increase the users cold/heat resistance.

Teenage Caveworm Vestige.name: Teenage Caveworm Vestige
Teenage Caveworm Vestige.description: Teenage Caveworm Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Teenage Caveworm Trophy .

Terrenus Vestige.name: Terrenus Vestige
Terrenus Vestige.description: Terrenus Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Terrenus Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Tusker Vestige.name: Tusker Vestige
Tusker Vestige.description: Tusker Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Tusker Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Ubis Vestige.name: Ubis Vestige
Ubis Vestige.description: Ubis Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Ubis Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Viscid Vestige.name: Viscid Vestige
Viscid Vestige.description: Viscid Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Viscid Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Wayfarer Arms Armor.name: Wayfarer Arms Armor
Wayfarer Arms Armor.description: Wayfarer Arms Armor is a mid-game Tier 3  crafted armor which can aid prospectors traveling through the Deserts on Icarus.
Wayfarer Arms Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Wayfarer Feet Armor.name: Wayfarer Feet Armor
Wayfarer Feet Armor.description: Wayfarer Feet Armor is a mid-game Tier 3  crafted armor which can aid prospectors traveling through the Deserts on Icarus.
Wayfarer Feet Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Wayfarer Head Armor.name: Wayfarer Head Armor
Wayfarer Head Armor.description: Wayfarer Head Armor is a mid-game Tier 3  crafted armor which can aid prospectors traveling through the Deserts on Icarus.
Wayfarer Head Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Wayfarer Leg Armor.name: Wayfarer Leg Armor
Wayfarer Leg Armor.description: Wayfarer Leg Armor is a mid-game Tier 3  crafted armor which can aid prospectors traveling through the Deserts on Icarus.
Wayfarer Leg Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Wild Boar Vestige.name: Wild Boar Vestige
Wild Boar Vestige.description: Wild Boar Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Wild Boar Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Wolf Vestige.name: Wolf Vestige
Wolf Vestige.description: Wolf Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Wolf Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary . They are also used at any textiles bench to make Wolf Rugs . Decorative purposes aside, both provide a boost to coziness, which increases the duration and effect of the Well Rested Buff .

Wooden Armor Stand.name: Wooden Armor Stand
Wooden Armor Stand.description: The Wooden Armor Stand is a deployable item to store a set of Armor for display purposes and to easily swap out the armor set.

Xigo \"Duo\" S5 Envirosuit.name: Xigo "Duo" S5 Envirosuit
Xigo \"Duo\" S5 Envirosuit.description: The Xigo "Duo" S5 Envirosuit is purchased in the Workshop on the Space Station .

Xigo \"Fermi\" S5 Envirosuit.name: Xigo "Fermi" S5 Envirosuit
Xigo \"Fermi\" S5 Envirosuit.description: The Xigo "Fermi" S5 Envirosuit is purchased in the Workshop on the Space Station .

Xigo \"Gustav\" S5 Envirosuit.name: Xigo "Gustav" S5 Envirosuit
Xigo \"Gustav\" S5 Envirosuit.description: The Xigo "Gustav" S5 Envirosuit is purchased in the Workshop on the Space Station .

Xigo \"Hark\" S5 Envirosuit.name: Xigo "Hark" S5 Envirosuit
Xigo \"Hark\" S5 Envirosuit.description: The Xigo "Hark" S5 Envirosuit is purchased in the Workshop on the Space Station .

Xigo S5 Envirosuit.name: Xigo S5 Envirosuit
Xigo S5 Envirosuit.description: The Xigo S5 Envirosuit is the default Envirosuit automatically equipped in the Prospector's loadout if an envirosuit is not equipped prior to starting a new prospect.

Xigo S5-II Envirosuit.name: Xigo S5-II Envirosuit
Xigo S5-II Envirosuit.description: The Xigo S5-II Envirosuit is the first unlockable envirosuit Prospectors can unlock in the Workshop on the Space Station .

Xigo S5-X Envirosuit.name: Xigo S5-X Envirosuit
Xigo S5-X Envirosuit.description: The Xigo S5-X Envirosuit is purchased in the Workshop on the Space Station .

Zebra Vestige.name: Zebra Vestige
Zebra Vestige.description: Zebra Vestiges are used at the Trophy Bench to create a Zebra Trophy , which can help prospectors complete the Bestiary .

Advanced Alteration Bench.name: Advanced Alteration Bench
Advanced Alteration Bench.description: The Advanced Alteration Bench is a late game technology that allows prospectors to create Attachment Packs ( Tier 3  ) and Advanced Attachment Packs ( Tier 4  ) to upgrade armor pieces, ranged weapons, and tools. An active power connection providing at least 1,500 electricity to craft Attachment Packs is required. A power connection is not required to add and remove Attachment packs from items.

Advanced Masonry Bench.name: Advanced Masonry Bench
Advanced Masonry Bench.description: The Advanced Masonry Bench enables the construction of Scoria Brick Building Pieces and Clay Brick Building Pieces and is able to craft items made the Masonry Bench at a faster rate, but only once the prospector researches the blueprint sets for those building pieces.

Advanced Textiles Bench.name: Advanced Textiles Bench
Advanced Textiles Bench.description: Allows for the crafting of more advanced Armor sets, Cured Leather and Platinum Weave . The Advanced Textiles Bench is also able to craft items made at the Textiles Bench , removing the need for multiple benches.

Alteration Bench.name: Alteration Bench
Alteration Bench.description: The Alteration Bench is a mid-to-late game technology that allows Prospectors to create Attachment Packs to upgrade armor pieces, ranged weapons, and tools.

Animal Bed.name: Animal Bed
Animal Bed.description: The Animal Bed serves as a place for juvenile animals to sleep while taming and is required to tame juvenile animals. Tamed Mounts and Pets can also use the Animal Bed when tired.

Anvil Bench.name: Anvil Bench
Anvil Bench.description: The Anvil Bench is unlocked near the start of the Tier 2  Tech Tree . It enables the Prospector to craft higher quality tools such as the Iron Pickaxe and Steel Pickaxe . It is also where these tools can be repaired. While it can be placed with no shelter, it would be unusable. Will take damage if left without shelter (or under a severely damaged roof) in storms.

Arctic Chest Armor.name: Arctic Chest Armor
Arctic Chest Armor.description: Arctic Armor is a major upgrade to Fur Armor , offering unrivaled cold resistance.
Arctic Chest Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Art Deco 10-Seater Table.name: Art Deco 10-Seater Table
Art Deco 10-Seater Table.description: The Art Deco 10-Seater Table is an gilded item of significant worth.

Art Deco 6-Seater Table.name: Art Deco 6-Seater Table
Art Deco 6-Seater Table.description: The Art Deco 6-Seater Table is an gilded item of significant worth.

Art Deco Bed.name: Art Deco Bed
Art Deco Bed.description: The Art Deco Bed allows prospectors to sleep provided it is sufficiently sheltered and it is night time in-game. In a multiplayer game, all prospectors must sleep at the same time to pass the night. Prospectors can set their respawn location to a bed, however if this bed is deconstructed or destroyed, the prospector's spawn location will reset back to the drop-pod. The Art Deco Bed has the best sleep quality of any bed.

Art Deco Dining Chair.name: Art Deco Dining Chair
Art Deco Dining Chair.description: The Art Deco Dining Chair is an gilded item of significant worth.

Art Deco Lounge Chair.name: Art Deco Lounge Chair
Art Deco Lounge Chair.description: The Art Deco Lounge Chair is an gilded item of significant worth.

Art Deco Round Table.name: Art Deco Round Table
Art Deco Round Table.description: The Art Deco Round Table is an gilded item of significant worth.

Art Deco Sitting Bench.name: Art Deco Sitting Bench
Art Deco Sitting Bench.description: The Art Deco Sitting Bench is an gilded item of significant worth.

Basic Fishing Bench.name: Basic Fishing Bench
Basic Fishing Bench.description: The Basic Fishing Bench is where Prospectors can craft the Wooden Fishing Rod and the Refined Wood Fishing Rod , as well as various Lures on the left hand side of the bench. The right side of the bench is used to fillet any fish caught using a Fishing Rod or Fishing Trap. Does not require shelter to be used.

Bedroll.name: Bedroll
Bedroll.description: The Bedroll allows prospectors to sleep provided it is sufficiently sheltered, a campfire/heater/dehumidifier/etc is nearby, and it is night time in-game. In a multiplayer game, all prospectors must sleep at the same time to pass the night. Sleeping will provide the Well Rested Status Effect . Prospectors can set their respawn location to a bedroll, however if this bedroll is picked up or destroyed, the prospector's spawn location will reset back to their drop pod.

Black Tusker Animal Bed.name: Black Tusker Animal Bed
Black Tusker Animal Bed.description: The Black Tusker Animal Bed is a bed for Mounts and Pets that has a tusker theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC . Provides no additional attributes and is a cosmetic change to the Animal Bed .

Bone Chest Armor.name: Bone Chest Armor
Bone Chest Armor.description: Bone Armor provides relatively good protection from Icarus' fauna as a Tier 1  armor with a minor boost to temperature resistance. Also provides a considerable damage increase when a full set is worn.

Brown Bear Chest Armor.name: Brown Bear Chest Armor
Brown Bear Chest Armor.description: Brown Bear Armor is an upgrade to Bone Armor , offering higher physical resistance with a boost to melee attack speed. Though it may not increase attack damage, it pairs well with the Calibrated Grip Attachment s and Attack Speed Attachment s, further increasing knife attack speed.
Brown Bear Chest Armor.crafted_at: Crafted AtTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Crafted AtTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

Brutalist 10-Seater Table.name: Brutalist 10-Seater Table
Brutalist 10-Seater Table.description: The Brutalist 10-Seater Table seats ten and is mode from concrete, copper nails and glass.

Brutalist 6-Seater Table.name: Brutalist 6-Seater Table
Brutalist 6-Seater Table.description: The Brutalist 6-Seater Table seats six, is mode from concrete, copper nails and glass.

Brutalist Bed.name: Brutalist Bed
Brutalist Bed.description: The Brutalist Bed is mode from concrete and platinum weave, and has an increased sleep quality.

Brutalist Coffee Table.name: Brutalist Coffee Table
Brutalist Coffee Table.description: The Brutalist Coffee Table is mode from concrete, iron and glass.

Brutalist Dining Chair.name: Brutalist Dining Chair
Brutalist Dining Chair.description: The Brutalist Dining Chair seats one and is mode from concrete and leather.

Brutalist Lounge Chair.name: Brutalist Lounge Chair
Brutalist Lounge Chair.description: The Brutalist Lounge Chair is a minimalist chair made with concrete and leather in the Brutalist design aesthetic. It serves as a seat for Prospectors and provides a small bonus to Coziness .

Brutalist Octagonal Table.name: Brutalist Octagonal Table
Brutalist Octagonal Table.description: The Brutalist Octagonal Table seats six and is mode from concrete and copper nails.

Brutalist Sitting Bench.name: Brutalist Sitting Bench
Brutalist Sitting Bench.description: The Brutalist Sitting Bench is made soley from concrete and seats two prospectors.

Burlap Animal Bed.name: Burlap Animal Bed
Burlap Animal Bed.description: The Burlap Animal Bed is a bed for Mounts and Pets that has a basic theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC . Provides no additional attributes and is a cosmetic change to the Animal Bed .

Carpentry Bench.name: Carpentry Bench
Carpentry Bench.description: While it can be placed with no shelter, it would be unusable. Will take damage if left without shelter (or under severely damaged roof) in storms.

Carved Wood Armchair.name: Carved Wood Armchair
Carved Wood Armchair.description: The Carved Wood Armchair is a decorative item.

Carved Wood Bed.name: Carved Wood Bed
Carved Wood Bed.description: The Carved Wood Bed allows prospectors to sleep provided it is sufficiently sheltered and it is night time in-game. In a multiplayer game, all prospectors must sleep at the same time to pass the night. Prospectors can set their respawn location to a bed, however if this bed is deconstructed or destroyed, the prospector's spawn location will reset back to the drop-pod.

Carved Wood Chair.name: Carved Wood Chair
Carved Wood Chair.description: The Carved Wood Chair is a decorative chair of two varieties, select R when deploying.

Carved Wood Coffee Table.name: Carved Wood Coffee Table
Carved Wood Coffee Table.description: The Carved Wood Coffee Table is a decorative item with two varieties, select R when deploying.

Carved Wood Large Table.name: Carved Wood Large Table
Carved Wood Large Table.description: The Carved Wood Large Table is a long wood table with room for 10 seats. The item has two build variants that can be selected with the 'R' key when deploying.

Carved Wood Round Table.name: Carved Wood Round Table
Carved Wood Round Table.description: The Carved Wood Round Table is a decorative round wood table.

Carved Wood Sitting Bench.name: Carved Wood Sitting Bench
Carved Wood Sitting Bench.description: The Carved Wood Sitting Bench is a decorative wooden bench that provides seating and a small bonus to Coziness .

Carved Wood Table.name: Carved Wood Table
Carved Wood Table.description: The Carved Wood Table is a decorative table with seating for six and a bonus to Coziness .

Charging Station.name: Charging Station
Charging Station.description: The Charging Station charges basic battery powered devices like the Flashlight and requires 500 Watts to function.

Chemistry Bench.name: Chemistry Bench
Chemistry Bench.description: Grants the Prospector the ability to swiftly create Medicine , Fertilizer , Volatile Substance and Distilled Miasmic Coating .

Cloth Chest Armor.name: Cloth Chest Armor
Cloth Chest Armor.description: Cloth Armor, while not being very protective in a fight, provides relatively good protection from the heat in deserts. It also makes traveling slightly quicker.

Composite Chest Armor.name: Composite Chest Armor
Composite Chest Armor.description: Composite Chest Armor is the highest tier of crafted armor in Icarus and thus provides superior protection from wildlife, while providing considerable insulation from the elements.

Concrete Furnace.name: Concrete Furnace
Concrete Furnace.description: Made at the Machining Bench , this Tier 3  furnace allows the smelting of mid-tier ores such as Steel Ingot + Super Cooled Ice into Cold Steel Ingots and Titanium Ore into Titanium Ingots .

Cooking Station.name: Cooking Station
Cooking Station.description: The Cooking Station is an early-game cooking bench that provides a way to for prospectors to process raw foods into resources, while also giving the prospector access to a variety of new foods with unique status effects.

Crafting Bench.name: Crafting Bench
Crafting Bench.description: The Crafting Bench allows the prospector to craft Tier 2  items. While it can be placed with no shelter, it would be unusable. Will take damage if left without shelter (or under severely damaged roof) in storms.

Crumbed Saltwater Fillet.name: Crumbed Saltwater Fillet
Crumbed Saltwater Fillet.description: Crumbed Saltwater Fillet is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Cured Leather Chest Armor.name: Cured Leather Chest Armor
Cured Leather Chest Armor.description: Cured Leather Armor is an upgrade to Leather Armor , providing an increase in physical resistance, thermal insulation, and a larger set bonus.
Cured Leather Chest Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Decoration Bench.name: Decoration Bench
Decoration Bench.description: Although prospectors may not use this bench often, it is required to complete Homestead: Construction .

Electric Carpentry Bench.name: Electric Carpentry Bench
Electric Carpentry Bench.description: The Electric Carpentry Bench allows for manufacturing of refined wood deployables at a faster rate than the Carpentry Bench . Prospectors can use the Electric Carpentry Bench to craft furniture, like an improved Wooden Bed , and storage items like an Interior Wood Cupboard . The Electric Carpentry Bench can also create Interior Wood building pieces.

Electric Furnace.name: Electric Furnace
Electric Furnace.description: The Electric Furnace is the end-game furnace capable of smelting Composite Paste into Composites , a material required for most Tier 4  blueprints, and can refine all other minerals faster than the lower tier furnaces.

Electric Masonry Bench.name: Electric Masonry Bench
Electric Masonry Bench.description: The Electric Masonry Bench enables the construction of Stone Building Pieces and Concrete Building Pieces at a faster rate than the Masonry Bench and Cement Mixer , but only once the Prospector researches the blueprints for building pieces. The Electric Masonry Bench can also craft all building pieces made at the Masonry Bench / Advanced Masonry Bench .

Electric Textiles Bench.name: Electric Textiles Bench
Electric Textiles Bench.description: A power connection providing at least 2,500 of power is required to utilize this bench. Allows for the crafting of more advanced Armor sets and items that can be made at the Textiles Bench and Advanced Textiles Bench .

Fabricator.name: Fabricator
Fabricator.description: The Fabricator is the late-game crafting bench, it enables the crafting of Weapons and Tools like the Combat Knife and a Titanium Pickaxe . It also enables the creation of power sources, such as the Biofuel Generator , and the Refrigerator .

Forge.name: Forge
Forge.description: The Forge is the Tier 3  variant of the Anvil Bench that will allow the Prospector to craft higher quality tools such as the Platinum Pickaxe , Cold Steel Knife , etc and items crafted at the Anvil Bench ( Iron Axe , Copper Nails , etc). It is also where these tools can be repaired. Unlike other benches, the Forge can be deployed and used outdoors as it does not require shelter. Can be used indoors or outdoors.

Fried Chunky Vegetables.name: Fried Chunky Vegetables
Fried Chunky Vegetables.description: Fried Chunky Vegetables is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Fur Chest Armor.name: Fur Chest Armor
Fur Chest Armor.description: Fur armor is a sidegrade to Leather Armor , offering slightly less physical resistance in exchange for a major boost to cold resistance, making it a necessity when venturing into cold regions. It, however, greatly reduces resistance to heat, making it problematic when delving into hotter biomes.
Fur Chest Armor.crafted_at: Crafted AtTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Crafted AtTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

Ghillie Chest Armor.name: Ghillie Chest Armor
Ghillie Chest Armor.description: Ghillie Chest Armor provides protection from the elements while also providing concealment from the keen eyes of prey.
Ghillie Chest Armor.crafted_at: Crafted AtTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Crafted AtTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

Glassworking Bench.name: Glassworking Bench
Glassworking Bench.description: The Glassworking Bench is a mid-to-late game technology that allows Prospectors to create Glass resources and construction elements, like the Glass Window and Glass Roof . In addition, Prospectors can create containers for food and beverages, such as the Glass Bottle and Glass Jar .

Heated Animal Bed.name: Heated Animal Bed
Heated Animal Bed.description: The Heated Animal Bed is a bed for Mounts and Pets that has a luxurious theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC . Provides no additional attributes and is a cosmetic change to the Animal Bed .

Heavy Obsidian Chest Armor.name: Heavy Obsidian Chest Armor
Heavy Obsidian Chest Armor.description: Heavy Obsidian Armor is a Tier 2  armor specialized in heat resistance with a slightly higher physical resistance than Leather Armor and a major boost in armor durability, great for taking on what the volcanic regions of Prometheus have to offer.
Heavy Obsidian Chest Armor.crafted_at: Crafted AtTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Crafted AtTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

Herbalism Bench.name: Herbalism Bench
Herbalism Bench.description: Allows for the crafting of Medicinal Pastes and Tonics such as Antibiotic Tonic to cure ailments and afflictions.

Hunter Chest Armor.name: Hunter Chest Armor
Hunter Chest Armor.description: An upgrade to Ghillie Armor with over double the physical/exposure resistance and an increase to crouch movement speed when a full set is worn. The ideal armor for hunting that will give any prospector the advantage over wild game.
Hunter Chest Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Industrial Bed.name: Industrial Bed
Industrial Bed.description: The Industrial Bed is made from metal and has an increased sleep quality.

Jaguar Buffalo Animal Bed.name: Jaguar Buffalo Animal Bed
Jaguar Buffalo Animal Bed.description: The Jaguar Buffalo Animal Bed is a bed for Mounts and Pets that has a Jaguar and Buffalo theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC . Provides no additional attributes and is a cosmetic change to the Animal Bed .

Kitchen Bench.name: Kitchen Bench
Kitchen Bench.description: The Kitchen Bench is a mid/late-game crafting bench that expands on cooking foods and it is also the path for creating more advanced medicines.

Kitchen Storage Block.name: Kitchen Storage Block
Kitchen Storage Block.description: A Kitchen Storage Block made of refined wood and copper nails, use it to store your kitchen essentials. Must be snapped to a Kitchen Bench to be placed. It has 40 inventory slots.

Leather Chest Armor.name: Leather Chest Armor
Leather Chest Armor.description: Leather armor may not offer much protection when fighting against Icarus' Fauna , but it offers more physical protection and thermal insulation than its Tier 1  counterparts, serving as a decent all-around armor for Tier 2  .
Leather Chest Armor.crafted_at: Crafted AtTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Crafted AtTextiles BenchAdvanced Textiles BenchElectric Textiles Bench

LM Beastmaster Chest Armor.name: LM Beastmaster Chest Armor
LM Beastmaster Chest Armor.description: The LM Beastmaster Chest Armor is part of the LM Beastmaster Armor Set , which can be unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospectors loadout before starting a new prospect. The armor set comes with buffs to Mounts and tamed creatures.

Machining Bench.name: Machining Bench
Machining Bench.description: Mid-level crafting system made at the Crafting Bench , the Machining Bench provides access to Tier 3  Blueprints. Prospectors can use it to create Deployables and Firearms .

Marble Kitchen Bench.name: Marble Kitchen Bench
Marble Kitchen Bench.description: The Marble Kitchen Bench is a late-game crafting bench that expands on cooking foods and contains the recipes that can be found in the Cooking Station . Crafts 50% faster than the Kitchen Bench . A water connection is not required for the Marble Kitchen Bench to function.

Marble Kitchen Storage.name: Marble Kitchen Storage
Marble Kitchen Storage.description: The Marble Kitchen Storage is used to store kitchen essentials and must be snapped to a Kitchen Bench to be placed. The Marble Kitchen Storage has 40 slots.

Masonry Bench.name: Masonry Bench
Masonry Bench.description: The Masonry Bench enables the construction of Stone Building Pieces and Scoria Building Pieces , but only once the prospector researches the blueprint sets for those building pieces.

Medicine Bench.name: Medicine Bench
Medicine Bench.description: Allows for the crafting of Medicinal Pastes and Tonics such as Antibiotic Pill , Survival Kits and Health Recovery Elixir to cure and prevent ailments and afflictions. It can also be used to craft Volatile Substance and Fertilizer .

MXC Furnace.name: MXC Furnace
MXC Furnace.description: The MXC Furnace is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect. The MXC Furnace functions like a smaller, more lightweight Stone Furnace , and allows for processing of Iron Ore , Copper Ore , and Steel Bloom into ingots.

Obsidian Chest Armor.name: Obsidian Chest Armor
Obsidian Chest Armor.description: Obsidian Armor is a sidegrade of Composite Armor , providing slightly more physical resistance and a substantial bonus to heat resistance.

Plumbed Sink.name: Plumbed Sink
Plumbed Sink.description: The Plumbed Sink is bench that can be connected to other Marble Appliances and, when connected to active water connection, provides a short buff when interacted with. The Buff increases crafting speed, movement speed, health regeneration, and reduced water and food consumption. 250 units of Water is required for the Plumbed Sink to function.

Portable Beacon.name: Portable Beacon
Portable Beacon.description: When deployed, the Portable Beacon will display a map marker that is visible on the map and compass, which is helpful for marking locations of caves/bases/predator spawns/or anything else a Prospector wishes to mark. When interacting with the Portable Beacon, Prospectors can choose from a list of available icons and colors to customize the icon displayed. Must be placed outdoors.

Portable Biofuel Generator.name: Portable Biofuel Generator
Portable Biofuel Generator.description: The Portable Biofuel Generator generates Electricity when supplied with biofuel from a Biofuel Can .

Portable Biofuel Tank.name: Portable Biofuel Tank
Portable Biofuel Tank.description: Portable Biofuel Tank is used for Biofuel storage. It is either filled at the Biofuel Composter or Electric Composter .

Portable Icebox Backpack.name: Portable Icebox Backpack
Portable Icebox Backpack.description: A handy backpack to prevent your food from spoiling on long journeys. Will run for 1 hour on a full charge. Can be recharged at a Charging Station .

Portable Water Tank.name: Portable Water Tank
Portable Water Tank.description: Portable Water Tank is a deployable that can be connected to a water network once placed to store 150,000 of water and can output 1,000 water per second to keep the network operational. It is the equivalent to a Water Barrel with having half of the storage, but it can be picked up into your character's Backpack/Equipment Slot (G).

Ranching Station.name: Ranching Station
Ranching Station.description: The Ranching Station allows the prospector to craft various Tier 2  equipment to use and maintain mounts and pets. This includes several Food Troughs / Water Troughs , Animal Beds , Saddles / Carts , Animal Feed , and other Ranching Deployables . Must be placed outside.

Regent Animal Bed.name: Regent Animal Bed
Regent Animal Bed.description: The Regent Animal Bed is a bed for Mounts and Pets that has a luxurious theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC . Provides no additional attributes and is a cosmetic change to the Animal Bed .

Repair Bench.name: Repair Bench
Repair Bench.description: The Repair Bench has the ability to repair all items you’re wearing or have placed on the bench with a single click, regardless of where they were crafted. When combined with a power connection (1,500 electricity ) it can also repair Tier 4  and Orbital Workshop items. To repair Orbital Workshop Items, a Workshop Repair Kit is required.

Roast Vegetables.name: Roast Vegetables
Roast Vegetables.description: Roast Vegetables is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Royal Animal Bed.name: Royal Animal Bed
Royal Animal Bed.description: The Royal Animal Bed is a bed for Mounts and Pets that has a luxurious theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC . Provides no additional attributes and is a cosmetic change to the Animal Bed .

Rustic Armchair.name: Rustic Armchair
Rustic Armchair.description: The Rustic Armchair seats one prospector

Rustic Bed.name: Rustic Bed
Rustic Bed.description: The Rustic Bed allows prospectors to sleep provided it is sufficiently sheltered and it is night time in-game. In a multiplayer game, all prospectors must sleep at the same time to pass the night. Prospectors can set their respawn location to a bed, however if this bed is deconstructed or destroyed, the prospector's spawn location will reset back to the drop-pod.

Rustic Coffee Table.name: Rustic Coffee Table
Rustic Coffee Table.description: The Rustic Coffee Table allows prospectors to store 10 items

Rustic Dining Chair.name: Rustic Dining Chair
Rustic Dining Chair.description: The Rustic Dining Chair a rustic chair that seats one prospector.

Rustic Large Table.name: Rustic Large Table
Rustic Large Table.description: The Rustic Large Table is a simple long wooden table.

Rustic Round Table.name: Rustic Round Table
Rustic Round Table.description: The Rustic Round Table is a simple wooden table.

Rustic Sitting Bench.name: Rustic Sitting Bench
Rustic Sitting Bench.description: The Rustic Sitting Bench seats two prospectors.

Rustic Table.name: Rustic Table
Rustic Table.description: The Rustic Table is a simple wooden table.

Salting Station.name: Salting Station
Salting Station.description: The Salting Station is an early-game cooking bench that provides a way to for Prospectors to preserve foods using Salt . Once a food is salted, it will receive the Preserved modifier, increasing spoil time by 100%. Salting a food item will reset its spoil timer, even if the item is nearly spoiled. This technique can be used to further extend the spoilage.

Sandworm Chest Armor.name: Sandworm Chest Armor
Sandworm Chest Armor.description: Sandworm Chest Armor is made from the scales dropped from a Sandworm . Provides exceptional heat protection with the added bonus of poison resistance when worn with a full set of Sandworm Armor .
Sandworm Chest Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Scorpion Chest Armor.name: Scorpion Chest Armor
Scorpion Chest Armor.description: Scorpion Chest Armor is a Tier 2  crafted armor requiring a Textiles Bench ; however, it is difficult to acquire due to the challenge of defeating Husk: Extermination and requiring Scorpion Carapace . It has unique set bonuses for returning damage to the attacker and has one of the highest physical resistances in the game.

Skinning Bench.name: Skinning Bench
Skinning Bench.description: The Skinning Bench is used to process, the small to medium carcasses, of the Fauna found on Icarus. While the yields from the skinning bench differ from skinning wildlife with Knives , most notably is the ability to always obtain rarer cuts of meat from fauna such as Raw Stringy Meat .

Snow Leopard Skin Animal Bed.name: Snow Leopard Skin Animal Bed
Snow Leopard Skin Animal Bed.description: The Snow Leopard Skin Animal Bed is a bed for Mounts and Pets that has a snow leopard theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC . Provides no additional attributes and is a cosmetic change to the Animal Bed .

Sprinters Animal Feed.name: Sprinters Animal Feed
Sprinters Animal Feed.description: Sprinters Animal Feed is a Animal Feed for Pets or Mounts with a unique Status Effect . Can be fed to mounts to satisfy Hunger . Sprinters Animal Feed decays in 10,800 seconds, but that decay can be slowed down by storing Sprinters Animal Feed inside an Ice Box or Refrigerator .

Stone Furnace.name: Stone Furnace
Stone Furnace.description: The Stone Furnace is used for smelting metals such as Iron Ore , Copper Ore , or Steel Bloom . Will take damage in storms if left un-sheltered.

Striker Terrenus Animal Bed.name: Striker Terrenus Animal Bed
Striker Terrenus Animal Bed.description: The Striker Terrenus Animal Bed is a bed for Mounts and Pets that has an... unsettling theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC . Provides no additional attributes and is a cosmetic change to the Animal Bed .

Textiles Bench.name: Textiles Bench
Textiles Bench.description: Allows for the crafting of various Armor sets, such as the Leather Armor Set , Fur Armor Set , Ghillie Armor Set , Sandworm Armor Set , and the Scorpion Armor Set . Items like the Basic Riding Saddle , Simple Creature Deterrent and Rope can also be made at the Textiles Bench.

Trophy Bench.name: Trophy Bench
Trophy Bench.description: The Trophy Bench allows prospectors to create Trophies from various Vestiges , for eventual display around a building or outpost.

Vegetable Oil.name: Vegetable Oil
Vegetable Oil.description: Vegetable Oil is an intermediary resource used to create Biofuel , Cured Leather , a Submachine Gun and various Food recipes.

Vegetable Pie.name: Vegetable Pie
Vegetable Pie.description: Vegetable Pie is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Vegetable Roll.name: Vegetable Roll
Vegetable Roll.description: Vegetable Roll is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Wayfarer Chest Armor.name: Wayfarer Chest Armor
Wayfarer Chest Armor.description: Wayfarer Chest Armor is a mid-game Tier 3  crafted armor which can aid prospectors traveling through the Deserts on Icarus.
Wayfarer Chest Armor.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Textiles Bench Electric Textiles Bench

Wolfskin Animal Bed.name: Wolfskin Animal Bed
Wolfskin Animal Bed.description: The Wolfskin Animal Bed is a bed for Mounts and Pets that has a wolf theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC . Provides no additional attributes and is a cosmetic change to the Animal Bed .

Wooden Bed.name: Wooden Bed
Wooden Bed.description: The Wooden Bed allows prospectors to sleep provided it is sufficiently sheltered and it is night time in-game. In a multiplayer game, all prospectors must sleep at the same time to pass the night. Prospectors can set their respawn location to a bed, however if this bed is deconstructed or destroyed, the prospector's spawn location will reset back to the drop-pod.

Wooden Chair.name: Wooden Chair
Wooden Chair.description: A Wooden Chair made of refined wood and copper nails.

Wood Table.name: Wood Table
Wood Table.description: The Wood Table is a decorative item that can be used for deployables like the Mortar and Pestle and provides a bonus to Coziness .

Zebra Animal Bed.name: Zebra Animal Bed
Zebra Animal Bed.description: The Zebra Animal Bed is a bed for Mounts and Pets that has a zebra theme. It is available as part of the Creature Comforts DLC . Provides no additional attributes and is a cosmetic change to the Animal Bed .

Aluminium Beam.description: Resistant to weather, but lighter than Stone Buildings, Aluminium Buildings are an asset when traveling to new areas far from your dropship or base, bringing with you the equivalent of a Stone Base in your backpack. Can be repaired with a Repair Hammer .

Basic Wall Light.name: Basic Wall Light

Carved Wood Wall Shelf.name: Carved Wood Wall Shelf
Carved Wood Wall Shelf.description: The Carved Wood Wall Shelf is a decorative item that has two varieties, select R when deploying.

Clay Brick Beam.name: Clay Brick Beam

Concrete Beam.name: Concrete Beam
Concrete Beam.description: The strongest and most durable structures on Icarus. If a prospector wishes to have a permanent outpost, without worry of structural damage from wind/rain/fire/bears, concrete is the only choice.

Dirt Corner.name: Dirt Corner
Dirt Corner.description: Dirt Corners are a Tier 1  buildable that are used in tandem with Dirt Ramps , allowing for the creation of rounded ramps. Due to the nature of its building material, Dirt Corners must be attached to the terrain when placed; failure to do so will result in the collapse of the building piece.

Dirt Foundation.name: Dirt Foundation
Dirt Foundation.description: Dirt Foundations are a Tier 1  buildable that serves as an alternative to Thatch Beams / Wood Beams that provides a more natural look to structures. Due to the nature of its building material, Dirt Foundations must be attached to the terrain when placed; failure to do so will result in the collapse of the building piece.

Dirt Ramp.name: Dirt Ramp
Dirt Ramp.description: Dirt Ramps are a Tier 1  buildable that serves as an alternative to Thatch Ramps / Wood Ramps that provides a more natural look to structures. Due to the nature of its building material, Dirt Ramps must be attached to the terrain when placed; failure to do so will result in the collapse of the building piece.

Reinforced Glass Beam.name: Reinforced Glass Beam

Reinforced Glass Floor.name: Reinforced Glass Floor

Thatch Beam.name: Thatch Beam
Thatch Beam.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For different orientations, hold R while holding a Thatch Beam (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

Thatch Door.name: Thatch Door
Thatch Door.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Can be attached to door frames (hold R while holding a Wall Building Piece and select the door frame variant from the radial menu).

Thatch Floor.name: Thatch Floor
Thatch Floor.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For the trapdoor floor variant, hold R while holding a Thatch Floor and select the Trapdoor variant from the radial wheel (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

Thatch Halfpieces.name: Thatch Halfpieces
Thatch Halfpieces.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For different variants, hold R while holding a Thatch Halfpiece (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

Thatch Halfpitches.name: Thatch Halfpitches
Thatch Halfpitches.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For different variants, hold R while holding Thatch Halfpitches (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

Thatch Ladder.name: Thatch Ladder
Thatch Ladder.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and best used as temporary shelters while away from any 'Main Base' the prospectors may have established. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Thatch ladders cannot be snapped to trapdoor floors.

Thatch Railing.name: Thatch Railing
Thatch Railing.description: The Thatch Railing is part of the Thatch Building Trim Set , which is learned in the Tier 1  Tech Tree after unlocking the Thatch Building Base Set .

Thatch Roof.name: Thatch Roof
Thatch Roof.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For the Ramp/Stairs variant, hold R while holding a Thatch Roof (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

Thatch Roof Corner.name: Thatch Roof Corner
Thatch Roof Corner.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For different variants, hold R while holding a Thatch Roof Corner (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

Thatch Trapdoor.name: Thatch Trapdoor
Thatch Trapdoor.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best suited as emergency shelters. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Attaches to floors with trapdoor holes (hold R while holding a floor building piece and select the Trapdoor variant from the radial wheel).

Thatch Wall.name: Thatch Wall
Thatch Wall.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters, or as scaffolding inside caves. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For window/doorway variants, hold R while holding a Thatch Wall (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

Thatch Wall Angled.name: Thatch Wall Angled
Thatch Wall Angled.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. For different variants, hold R while holding a Thatch Wall Angled (more item actions can be seen bottom right).

Thatch Window.name: Thatch Window
Thatch Window.description: Thatch building pieces are very light-weight and are best used for emergency shelters. While subject to damage from milder storms than any other material, they are light enough to carry and will still offer protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Attaches to window frames (hold R while holding a wall building piece and select the Window Frame variant from the radial wheel).

Wall Torch.name: Wall Torch
Wall Torch.description: Wall lighting for a prospector's base. Provides limited heat. Will not be damaged by storms if placed outside.

Wood Beam.name: Wood Beam
Wood Beam.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood beams require another structure for adjacent 'snapping' and seem to apply 'well stabilized' to a larger area than the Thatch Beam .

Wood Door.name: Wood Door
Wood Door.description: Wood Door is crafted in the Character Crafting with the following resources:

Wood Floor.name: Wood Floor
Wood Floor.description: Wood Floor is crafted in the Character Crafting with the following resources:

Wood Roof.name: Wood Roof
Wood Roof.description: Wood Roof is crafted in the Character Crafting with the following resources:

Wood Roof Corner.name: Wood Roof Corner
Wood Roof Corner.description: Wood Roof Corner is crafted in the Character Crafting with the following resources:

Wood Trapdoor.name: Wood Trapdoor
Wood Trapdoor.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for Prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable, they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Attaches to floors with trapdoor holes (hold R while holding a floor piece and select the Trapdoor variant from the radial wheel).

Wood Wall.name: Wood Wall
Wood Wall.description: Wood Wall is crafted in the Character Crafting with the following resources:

Wood Wall Angled.name: Wood Wall Angled
Wood Wall Angled.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood wall angles may be snapped into existing floors or walls such as Wood Wall . Holding 'R' while placing the angled wood wall for additional placement styles or directionality.

Wood Wall Fortification.name: Wood Wall Fortification
Wood Wall Fortification.description: The Wood Wall Fortification serves as large wall that can attach Wood Spikes Fortifications to fend off the predators of Icarus. Similar to Medium Wood Hedgehogs , the Wood Wall Fortification does not take damage during storms.

Wood Window.name: Wood Window
Wood Window.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for Prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable, they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood Windows may be snapped into walls such as Wood Wall that have been placed in 'window' configuration. Holding 'R' while placing a Wood Wall , for example, allows for additional placement styles, such as the window frame.

Advanced Fishing Trap.name: Advanced Fishing Trap
Advanced Fishing Trap.description: One approach to catching fish is by using a Fishing Trap. Though a Lure is not required, attaching one can increase the quality, length, and weight of the caught fish. Additionally, certain lures can increase the odds of catching a rarer type of fish. To attach a lure to the Advanced Fishing Trap, inspect the trap by pressing 'F' and drag the lure into the dedicated lure slot.

Basic Dried Meat.name: Basic Dried Meat
Basic Dried Meat.description: Basic Dried Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Basic Fishing Rod.name: Basic Fishing Rod
Basic Fishing Rod.description: One approach to catching fish is by using a Fishing Rod. Though a lure is not required, attaching one can increase the quality, length, and weight of the caught fish. Additionally, certain lures can increase the odds of catching fish of a certain rarity or increase the size of the capture area. For a list of available lures, view this page .

Basic Fishing Trap.name: Basic Fishing Trap
Basic Fishing Trap.description: One approach to catching fish is by using a Fishing Trap. Though a Lure is not required, attaching one can increase the quality, length, and weight of the caught fish. Additionally, certain lures can increase the odds of catching a rarer type of fish. To attach a lure to the Basic Fishing Trap, inspect the trap by pressing 'F' and drag the lure into the dedicated lure slot.

Berry Farming Packet.name: Berry Farming Packet
Berry Farming Packet.description: The Berry Farming Packet is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospectors loadout before starting a new prospect. Only after landing on Icarus can the packet be consumed, giving the Prospector five Berry seeds, which then can be planted in Dirt Mounds or Crop plots to grow Plant Resources .

Berry Jam.name: Berry Jam
Berry Jam.description: Berry Jam is a long-lasting Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Berry Jam, Strawberry Jam and Pickled Carrot , does not spoil and is therefore a valuable food for long-term storage.

Berry & Seed Bar.name: Berry & Seed Bar
Berry & Seed Bar.description: Full of energy for long hikes, long lasting effects and easily crafted.

Berry Smoked Saltwater Fillet.name: Berry Smoked Saltwater Fillet
Berry Smoked Saltwater Fillet.description: Berry Smoked Saltwater Fillet is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Bread.name: Bread
Bread.description: Bread is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Bread Dough.name: Bread Dough
Bread Dough.description: Bread Dough is the precursor to the mid/late-game Food Bread . Bread Dough will eventually decay, but can be preserved in an Ice Box , Refrigerator , or Deep Freeze .

Caramel Berry Tart.name: Caramel Berry Tart
Caramel Berry Tart.description: Caramel Berry Tart is late-game Food that when consumed provides a considerable boost to stamina, speed, resistance to cave sickness and a chance to mine additional stone.

Cocoa Smoked Soft Meat.name: Cocoa Smoked Soft Meat
Cocoa Smoked Soft Meat.description: Cocoa Smoked Soft Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Cooked Bacon.name: Cooked Bacon
Cooked Bacon.description: Cooked Bacon is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Cooked Fatty T-Bone.name: Cooked Fatty T-Bone
Cooked Fatty T-Bone.description: Cooked Fatty T-Bone is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Cooked Gamey Meat.name: Cooked Gamey Meat
Cooked Gamey Meat.description: Cooked Gamey Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Cooked Giant Steak.name: Cooked Giant Steak
Cooked Giant Steak.description: Cooked Giant Steak is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Cooked Meat.name: Cooked Meat
Cooked Meat.description: Cooked Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Cooked Soft Meat.name: Cooked Soft Meat
Cooked Soft Meat.description: Cooked Soft Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Cooked Stringy Meat.name: Cooked Stringy Meat
Cooked Stringy Meat.description: Cooked Stringy Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Cooked White Meat.name: Cooked White Meat
Cooked White Meat.description: Cooked White Meat is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Dried Gamey Meat.name: Dried Gamey Meat
