Source
 Caveworms


Location
Caves



Misc Info




Weight
Stack Size




1

Potato.name: Potato
Potato.description: A plant which grows in the Swamp and Tundra Biomes on Prometheus. They can be harvested most efficiently with the use of Sickles .

Prototype Thumper.name: Prototype Thumper
Prototype Thumper.description: The more ore available, the bigger the impact on the surrounding environment, so expect more opposition when taking on lucrative deposits in densely populated areas.

Pumpkin.name: Pumpkin
Pumpkin.description: Pumpkin are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus. When consumed by prospectors, they replenish Hunger .

Reed Flower.name: Reed Flower
Reed Flower.description: Reed flowers can be found alongside water in the Forest Biome on Icarus. They can be harvested most efficiently with a Sickle .

Resources.name: Resources
Resources.description: Prospectors face a host of challenges when they drop onto Icarus. They must maintain an adequate supply of Oxygen , Water and Food , craft Shelter from the planet’s storms, and survive encounters with the Fauna . Prospectors will need to rely on a wide range of resources: some they will find in the wild, and others they will make themselves. How prospectors master the use of these resources will determine their overall success during their limited time on Icarus.

Sandworm.name: Sandworm
Sandworm.description: A monstrous beast that lives beneath the sand on Olympus and Styx.

Sandworm Scale.name: Sandworm Scale
Sandworm Scale.description: Harvested from Sandworms , attacking the body of a Sandworm will break off scales which fall to the ground. However, be quick about retrieval as these scales are lost to the dunes quickly.
harvested_from: attacking the body of a S
worm will break off scales which fall to the ground

Scorpion Carapace.name: Scorpion Carapace
Scorpion Carapace.description: Scorpion Carapace is required for Scorpion Armor , a set with one of the highest physical resistances in the game. Must complete Husk: Extermination to unlock the recipe for this resource to be useful.

Seeds.name: Seeds
Seeds.description: Seeds are a resource harvested from Flora or produced in a Seed Extractor that can be planted in Dirt Mounds or Crop Plots to produce more of that specific crop.
harvested_from: Flora or produced in a Seed Extractor that can be planted in Dirt Mounds or Crop Plots to produce more of that specific crop

Sheep.name: Sheep
Sheep.description: A sheep preserved in cryogenic stasis that can be deployed and defrosted on a planet.

Silica Ore.name: Silica Ore
Silica Ore.description: Silica Ore is a Mineral found on the surface of Icarus. Prospectors are likely to first use silica to create the Mortar and Pestle . However, it is also the key in making glass and concrete.

Sinotai Dropship Recall Beacon.name: Sinotai Dropship Recall Beacon
Sinotai Dropship Recall Beacon.description: The Sinotai Dropship Recall Beacon will fire a flare that calls the Prospectors dropship to that location when thrown, which can either be used for immediate extraction or left there for use later on. Multiple Recall Beacons can be used per session, however, these are one-use items, so use them carefully. Items stored in the dropships inventory will not be lost when the dropship is called, allowing Prospectors to transport equipment/resources over large distances.

Small Interior Wood Crate.name: Small Interior Wood Crate
Small Interior Wood Crate.description: A Small Interior Wood Crate made of refined wood and copper nails. Similar size to the Small Wood Crate .

Small Stone Sign.name: Small Stone Sign
Small Stone Sign.description: The Small Stone Sign is a deployable sign post available as a wall sign, floor sign or a small angled variant.
Small Stone Sign.crafted_at: Crafted AtMasonry BenchAdvanced Masonry BenchElectric Masonry Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Crafted AtMasonry BenchAdvanced Masonry BenchElectric Masonry Bench

Small Tree.name: Small Tree
Small Tree.description: A small, immature tree, most often growing in wooded areas of the Forest Biome on Icarus. Can be harvested by hand for Sticks and Fiber , but more efficiently with an Axe .

Small Wood Crate.name: Small Wood Crate
Small Wood Crate.description: The Small Wood Crate is the first available storage container that can be made by the prospector. While limited in inventory space, anything here will not be lost upon the death of the prospector or count against inventory weight. Like most other Deployables , this must be under Shelter or it will be destroyed when exposed to Weather events. It is possible to loot the contents if this crate is destroyed, but only for a limited time.

Small Wood Sign.name: Small Wood Sign
Small Wood Sign.description: A Small Wood Sign made of Refined Wood and Copper Nails .

Soy Bean.name: Soy Bean
Soy Bean.description: Soy Beans are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus.

Sponge.name: Sponge
Sponge.description: Sponges are found growing in bodies of water on Icarus and are gathered by hand. Sponges are also be obtained through the use of Water Wheels and Basic Fishing Traps / Advanced Fishing Traps . Sponges can be identified with this reference image:

Squash.name: Squash
Squash.description: Squash are a common form of Plantlife found in the Desert locations on Icarus. When consumed by prospectors, they replenish Hunger .

Stick.name: Stick
Stick.description: Sticks are harvested by picking them up off of the ground, or when harvesting small trees and saplings. Sticks can also be crafted from wood at the Carpentry Bench , or in the Character Crafting menu if you have the Wood Breakdown talent (and its matching Blueprint in Tier 1 ).

Stone.name: Stone
Stone.description: Stone is one of the most abundant Minerals available on Icarus. Prospectors will make extensive use of stone from the moment they exit their drop-pods, as it is widely used in the early game for both Tools and Weapons .

Stonejaw Trophy.name: Stonejaw Trophy
Stonejaw Trophy.description: Stonejaw Trophies are decorative deployables that can be placed on any wall surface and are used to liven any living space. Aside from helping prospectors complete the Bestiary , it can also be used in tandem with other Furniture to increase the Coziness of your living quarters, increasing the duration and effectiveness of the Well Rested Buff .

Stone Brick.name: Stone Brick
Stone Brick.description: Stone Bricks are a refined resource primarily used to craft Stone Brick Building Pieces at an Advanced Masonry Bench / Electric Masonry Bench .
Stone Brick.crafted_at: Advanced Masonry Bench Electric Masonry Bench

base_recipe.crafted_at: Advanced Masonry Bench Electric Masonry Bench

Stone Brick Halfpieces.name: Stone Brick Halfpieces
Stone Brick Halfpieces.description: Stone Brick pieces offer +10 Insulation from Temperature, +100% Falling Tree Resistance and +65% Wind Resistance.

Stone Brick Halfpitches.name: Stone Brick Halfpitches
Stone Brick Halfpitches.description: Stone Brick pieces offer +10 Insulation from Temperature, +100% Falling Tree Resistance and +65% Wind Resistance.

Stone Buffalo Statue.name: Stone Buffalo Statue
Stone Buffalo Statue.description: The Stone Buffalo Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Cairn.name: Stone Cairn
Stone Cairn.description: Stone Cairns are a deployable item can be used as waystones to mark a path across the landscape or to mark areas of significance. Stone Cairns also have one inventory slot that can be used to store deceased pets, marking their grave and providing them a small memorial. When inspecting the Stone Cairn by pressing F, the name and description can be changed as needed.

Stone Caveworm Statue.name: Stone Caveworm Statue
Stone Caveworm Statue.description: The Stone Caveworm Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Deer Statue.name: Stone Deer Statue
Stone Deer Statue.description: The Stone Deer Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Elephant Statue.name: Stone Elephant Statue
Stone Elephant Statue.description: The Stone Elephant Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Frame.name: Stone Frame
Stone Frame.description: Stronger than Wood, and resistant to weather, Stone Buildings are a game changer when it comes to surviving on Icarus.
Stone Frame.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

Stone Halfpieces.name: Stone Halfpieces
Stone Halfpieces.description: Stronger than Wood, and resistant to weather, Stone Buildings are a game changer when it comes to surviving on Icarus.
Stone Halfpieces.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

Stone Halfpitches.name: Stone Halfpitches
Stone Halfpitches.description: Stronger than Wood, and resistant to weather, Stone Buildings are a game changer when it comes to surviving on Icarus.
Stone Halfpitches.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Masonry Bench with the following resources:

Stone Komodo Statue.name: Stone Komodo Statue
Stone Komodo Statue.description: The Stone Komodo Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Pile.name: Stone Pile
Stone Pile.description: The Stone Pile, alongside the Wood Pile , are makeshift storage options for large quantities of each raw material. The Stone Pile is immune to ALL Weather damage and can be used as a durable barrier to Fauna , especially against Fauna like the Grizzly Bear . If placed with just a narrow opening between piles, Bears have an incredibly difficult time getting through which allows the Prospector to melee attack just beyond the bear's attack range.

Stone Piranha Statue.name: Stone Piranha Statue
Stone Piranha Statue.description: The Stone Piranha Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Rabbit Statue.name: Stone Rabbit Statue
Stone Rabbit Statue.description: The Stone Rabbit Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Water Trough.name: Stone Water Trough
Stone Water Trough.description: The Stone Water Trough is a decorative upgrade to the Water Trough that allows multiple creatures to drink from it simultaneously and can be connected to Water using a Water Pipe Tool , similar to the Large Water Trough . The Stone Water Trough can only store water and cannot provide water to the rest of the network like Water Barrels or Metal Rain Reservoirs .

Tea.name: Tea
Tea.description: Tea are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus.

Threshing Attachment.name: Threshing Attachment
Threshing Attachment.description: Threshing Attachment is a mid game item available once the prospector has unlocked the Tool Attachment Pack tech.

Titanium Ore.name: Titanium Ore
Titanium Ore.description: Titanium Ore is a late-game Mineral, and can be utilized by prospectors after they reach level 30 and unlock the Fabricator in the Tier 4  Tech Tree . Titanium represents the current pinnacle of material strength for Tools and for several Weapons .

Tomato.name: Tomato
Tomato.description: Tomato are a fruit found growing on bushes in the Grassland Biome on Icarus. They can be harvested by hand or more efficiently with the use of a Sickle .
harvested_from: area or grown in Crop Plots or Dirt Mounds by planting Seeds obtained by harvesting or from purchasing a Tomato Farming Packet

Vapor Condenser.name: Vapor Condenser
Vapor Condenser.description: The Vapor Condenser is a deployable that can be placed on Enzyme Geysers to extract Condensed Enzymes and Exotics (depending on the game mode).

Volatile Exotic Seed.name: Volatile Exotic Seed
Volatile Exotic Seed.description: Volatile Exotic Seeds are a resource obtained from Strange Plants that can be planted in Dirt Mounds or Crop Plots to produce more Volatile Raw Exotics .

Watermelon.name: Watermelon
Watermelon.description: Watermelons are a common form of Plantlife found in the Forest and Riverlands locations on Icarus. When consumed by Prospectors, they replenish Hunger and Thirst .

Water Borer.name: Water Borer
Water Borer.description: The Water Borer is a device that can be placed on Enzyme Geysers and when powered, can be used to extract Water which can be fed into a water network.

Wheat.name: Wheat
Wheat.description: A tall grass which grows in clusters in the Forest Biome on Icarus. They can be harvested most efficiently with the use of Sickles . Can be processed into flour using the Mortar and Pestle .

Wood.name: Wood
Wood.description: Wood is a basic crafting ingredient obtained from Trees using an axe or harvested by hand in the Desert via Cacti. Wood can also be used as a Fuel source for Campfire , Fireplace , and Stone Furnace .

Wooden Lure.name: Wooden Lure
Wooden Lure.description: The Wooden Lure can be attached to a Fishing Rod or a Basic Fishing Trap / Advanced Fishing Trap to provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. Like all Lures , the Wooden Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

Wooden Shovel.name: Wooden Shovel
Wooden Shovel.description: The Wooden Shovel is an early-game Tool used to create Dirt Mounds (right-click), harvest Ice / Dirt / Sand (left-click), or remove ash/snow buildup on structures in the Arctic / Volcanic biomes on Icarus.

Wood Buffalo Statue.name: Wood Buffalo Statue
Wood Buffalo Statue.description: The Wood Buffalo Statue is a decorative wood item.

Wood Burner.name: Wood Burner
Wood Burner.description: The Wood Burner is a source of heat and basic cooking similar to a Campfire or Fireplace . It provides the Warming Fire effect (heat and +100% Perceived Threat) allowing a Prospector to sleep nearby. Once fuel is added, it can be activated and will consume fuel regardless of any selected recipe.

Wood Composter.name: Wood Composter
Wood Composter.description: Wood Composter increases the rate at which food spoils, and will turn Spoiled Plants or Guano into Basic Fertilizer .

Wood Crop Plot.name: Wood Crop Plot
Wood Crop Plot.description: The Wood Crop Plot is a farming plot for growing Seeds that can later be harvested for Plant Resources once fully grown. Unless the Prospector has the Fresh Is Best talent when deploying a seed into the crop plot, the grown Plant Resource will eventually wither if not harvested.

Wood Cupboard.name: Wood Cupboard
Wood Cupboard.description: Taking up the same floor-space but with a much larger inventory, this is a great upgrade from the Medium Wood Crate .
Wood Cupboard.crafted_at: Crafted AtCrafting BenchCarpentry BenchElectric Carpentry BenchMachining BenchFabricator

base_recipe.crafted_at: Crafted AtCrafting BenchCarpentry BenchElectric Carpentry BenchMachining BenchFabricator

Wood Deer Statue.name: Wood Deer Statue
Wood Deer Statue.description: The Wood Deer Statue is a decorative wood item.

Wood Gate Fortification.name: Wood Gate Fortification
Wood Gate Fortification.description: The Wood Gate Fortification serves as an entrance when using Wood Wall Fortifications . Similar to Medium Wood Hedgehogs , the Wood Gate Fortification does not take damage during storms. Wood Spikes Fortification cannot be mounted to the Wood Gate Fortification.

Wood Halfpieces.name: Wood Halfpieces
Wood Halfpieces.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood roofs or walls require a floor or wall structure such as Wood Wall for snapping. Hold 'R' while placing the Wood Halfpieces itself to determine shape as well as placement as roof, or wall.

Wood Halfpitches.name: Wood Halfpitches
Wood Halfpitches.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood roofs or walls require a floor or wall structure such as Wood Wall for snapping. Hold 'R' while placing the Wood Halfpitches itself to determine shape as well as placement as roof, or wall.

Wood Javelin.name: Wood Javelin
Wood Javelin.description: The Wood Javelin is a variant of the Wood Spear that can only be thrown. The Wood Javelin has the slowest projectile travel time and highest projectile fall-off, but that can be overlooked by it's cheap producibility.

Wood Ladder.name: Wood Ladder
Wood Ladder.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for Prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable, they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood Ladders can be use with Trapdoor holes (hold R while holding a floor building piece and select the Trapdoor variant from the radial wheel). Does not snap to trapdoor holes.

Wood Pile.name: Wood Pile
Wood Pile.description: The Wood Pile, alongside the Stone Pile , are makeshift storage options for large quantities of each raw material. Though immune to most Weather damage, beware of lightning strikes. Can be used as a durable barrier to Fauna , especially against Fauna like the Grizzly Bear , although the stone variant is preferred.

Wood Piranha Statue.name: Wood Piranha Statue
Wood Piranha Statue.description: The Wood Piranha Statue is a decorative wood item.

Wood Rabbit Statue.name: Wood Rabbit Statue
Wood Rabbit Statue.description: The Wood Rabbit Statue is a decorative wood item.

Wood Railing.name: Wood Railing
Wood Railing.description: The Wood Railing is part of the Wood Building Trim Set , which is learned in the Tier 1  Tech Tree after unlocking the Wood Building Base Set .

Wood Railing Gate.name: Wood Railing Gate
Wood Railing Gate.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for Prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable, they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offers good protection to Deployables and Storage containers. Wood Railing Gates can be deployed on their own or can be snapped to railings/floors.

Wood Shield.name: Wood Shield
Wood Shield.description: The Wood Shield is crafted at the Anvil, Forge, or Foundry with the following resources:

Wood Spikes Fortification.name: Wood Spikes Fortification
Wood Spikes Fortification.description: The Wood Spikes Fortification serves as large hedgehog that can attach Wood Wall Fortifications to fend off the predators of Icarus. Similar to Medium Wood Hedgehogs , the Wood Spikes Fortification does not take damage during storms.

Wood Walkway Fortification.name: Wood Walkway Fortification
Wood Walkway Fortification.description: The Wood Walkway Fortification is attached to Wood Wall Fortifications and serves as a platform that Prospectors can stand on, providing them a vantage point to see over their walls. Similar to Medium Wood Hedgehogs , the Wood Walkway Fortification does not take damage during storms.

Wool.name: Wool
Wool.description: Wool from sheep can be used to craft arctic pelt, platinum weave or rope.

Yeast.name: Yeast
Yeast.description: A small flower which grows in groups in the Forest Biome on Icarus. They can be harvested most efficiently with the use of Sickles .

Young Coconut.name: Young Coconut
Young Coconut.description: Harvested from palm trees in the Desert , when chopping their tops with an axe. If a prospector lets it decay, it will ripen into a Ripe Coconut .
harvested_from: when chopping their tops with an axe

Advanced Deep Mining Ore Scanner.name: Advanced Deep Mining Ore Scanner
Advanced Deep Mining Ore Scanner.description: Locates Deep Ore Deposits within the area that can be mined with a Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill or an Electric Deep-Mining Drill . Unlike the Deep Mining Ore Scanner , the Advanced Deep Mining Ore Scanner can be toggled to detect specific deep ore deposits.

Battery Powered Lantern.name: Battery Powered Lantern
Battery Powered Lantern.description: The Battery Powered Lantern is a portable Handheld Light Source that provides illumination in the surrounding area. Can be equipped in the "L" light slot on the hotbar.

Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill.name: Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill
Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill.description: The Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill will mine deep mining ore deposits when supplied with biofuel from a Biofuel Can / MXC Fuel Canister . The Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill has 5 slots and will last 2 hours and 5 minutes on a full Biofuel Can .

Biofuel Radar.name: Biofuel Radar
Biofuel Radar.description: The Biofuel Radar is used to scan for Exotic / Volatile Raw Exotic deposits. Once activated, aggravated Fauna (varies per region) will attempt to destroy the radar by any means necessary. Radars of all types will show ALL exotic veins on the map in each scan, regardless of whether they have been depleted. Scans performed in an Outpost will not complete as there are no exotic veins in them. This can be used to spawn aggressive wildlife for resources or experience.

Cave Scanner.name: Cave Scanner
Cave Scanner.description: Locates caves with audible beeping. While the cave scanner is equipped and in hand the scanner's lights will blink and it will beep so long as a cave is somewhat nearby. The frequency of blinking/beeping increases as the Prospector approaches a cave. Furthermore, the scanner will beep more rapidly if the Prospector is looking in the direction of a cave.

Deep Mining Ore Scanner.name: Deep Mining Ore Scanner
Deep Mining Ore Scanner.description: Locates Deep Ore Deposits within the area that can be mined with a Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill or an Electric Deep-Mining Drill . Does not indicate the type of deep ore deposit detected, unlike the Advanced Deep Mining Ore Scanner .

Electric Deep-Mining Drill.name: Electric Deep-Mining Drill
Electric Deep-Mining Drill.description: The Electric Deep-Mining Drill will mine Deep Mining Ore Deposits when supplied with 2,000 units of Power . The Electric Deep-Mining Drill has more inventory slots, twenty in all, 15 more slots than its biofuel counterpart. This allows 1000 or 2000 ore to be accumulated before needing to be emptied, depending on the ore type.

Electric Radar.name: Electric Radar
Electric Radar.description: The Electric Radar is used to scan for Exotic / Volatile Raw Exotic deposits. Once activated, aggravated Fauna (varies per region) will attempt to destroy the radar by any means necessary. Radars of all types will show ALL exotic veins on the map in each scan, regardless of whether they have been depleted. Scans performed in an Outpost will not complete as there are no exotic veins in them. This can be used to spawn aggressive wildlife for resources or experience.

IC-001 Radar.name: IC-001 Radar
IC-001 Radar.description: The IC-001 Radar is used to scan for Exotic / Volatile Raw Exotic deposits. Once activated, aggravated Fauna (varies per region) will attempt to destroy the radar by any means necessary. Radars of all types will show ALL exotic veins on the map in each scan, regardless of whether they have been depleted. Scans performed in an Outpost will not complete as there are no exotic veins in them. This can be used to spawn aggressive wildlife for resources or experience.

Lantern.name: Lantern
Lantern.description: Similar to torches, the durability of the Lantern will decrease over time. The Lantern can be repaired (refilled) at a Crafting Bench with 1 Animal Fat . The Lantern will last about 45 minutes when lit before needing repairs. The Lantern allows prospectors to see approximately 10 meters, or 5 standard floor pieces, from their position.

Wood Rag Torch.name: Wood Rag Torch
Wood Rag Torch.description: The first available source of Light Source . Can be equipped in the "L" light slot on the hotbar. When lit, the Wood Rag Torch also provides heat in addition to light. The Wood Rag Torch will last about 33 minutes and 20 seconds when lit before extinguishing. The Wood Rag Torch allows prospectors to see approximately 6 meters, or 3 standard floor pieces, from their position.

Wood Torch.name: Wood Torch
Wood Torch.description: The Wood Torch is an upgraded handheld Light Source that will last longer than the Wood Rag Torch . Can be equipped in the "L" light slot on the hotbar and provides heat when lit. The Wood Torch will last about 50 minutes when lit before extinguishing. The Wood Torch allows prospectors to see approximately 6 meters, or 3 standard floor pieces, from their position.

Black Wolf Knife.name: Black Wolf Knife
Black Wolf Knife.description: The Black Wolf Knife is a knife with a 25% chance to inflict hemorrhage on targets and can be used as a tool to skin fauna. For the thrown variant of the Black Wolf Knife, view Black Wolf Throwing Knife .

Black Wolf Throwing Knife.name: Black Wolf Throwing Knife
Black Wolf Throwing Knife.description: The Black Wolf Throwing Knife is a variant of the Black Wolf Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Black Wolf Knife , the Black Wolf Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Bone Knife.name: Bone Knife
Bone Knife.description: The Bone Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from the Stone Knife , the Bone Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool.

Bone Spear.name: Bone Spear
Bone Spear.description: Spears increase the range to which Prospectors can attack fauna, providing a unique advantage when up high. The Bone Spear has twice as much health than the Wood Spear , which can be the difference between winning and losing against Icarus' fauna. Unlike the Bone Javelin , the Bone Spear cannot be thrown.

Bone Throwing Knife.name: Bone Throwing Knife
Bone Throwing Knife.description: The Bone Throwing Knife is a variant of the Bone Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Bone Knife , the Bone Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Carbon Spear.name: Carbon Spear
Carbon Spear.description: The Carbon Spear is an upgrade to the Platinum Spear that deals more damage and is cheaper to craft. Unlike the Carbon Javelin , the Carbon Spear cannot be thrown.

Caveworm Knife.name: Caveworm Knife
Caveworm Knife.description: The Caveworm Knife is made with resources obtained from Caveworms . Though the Caveworm Knife can be used as a melee weapon or tool to skin fauna, the Caveworm Knife has very little durability, which can prove problematic while on the go as it can only be repaired at an Anvil Bench .

Caveworm Spear.name: Caveworm Spear
Caveworm Spear.description: Spears increase the range to which Prospectors can attack fauna, providing a unique advantage when up high. Unlike the Caveworm Javelin , the Caveworm Spear cannot be thrown.

Caveworm Throwing Knife.name: Caveworm Throwing Knife
Caveworm Throwing Knife.description: The Caveworm Throwing Knife is a variant of the Caveworm Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Caveworm Knife , the Caveworm Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Cold Steel Axe.name: Cold Steel Axe
Cold Steel Axe.description: The Cold Steel Axe is a mid/late-game Axe that is introduced with Chapter - New Frontier . The Cold Steel Axe can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

Cold Steel Knife.name: Cold Steel Knife
Cold Steel Knife.description: The Cold Steel Knife is a mid/late-game Knife that is introduced with the addition of Cold Steel Ingots on the Prometheus map.

Cold Steel Pickaxe.name: Cold Steel Pickaxe
Cold Steel Pickaxe.description: The Cold Steel Pickaxe is a mid/late-game Pickaxe that was introduced with New Frontiers .

Cold Steel Sledgehammer.name: Cold Steel Sledgehammer
Cold Steel Sledgehammer.description: Cold Steel Sledgehammer is a Tier 3  Sledgehammer made with Cold Steel Ingots . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Cold Steel Spear.name: Cold Steel Spear
Cold Steel Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike the Cold Steel Javelin , the Cold Steel Spear cannot be thrown.

Cold Steel Throwing Knife.name: Cold Steel Throwing Knife
Cold Steel Throwing Knife.description: The Cold Steel Throwing Knife is a variant of the Cold Steel Knife that can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching the Cold Steel Knife . Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Combat Knife.name: Combat Knife
Combat Knife.description: While not particularly good for skinning a carcass, this knife excels in close quarters combat. Cannot be thrown.

Composite Spear.name: Composite Spear
Composite Spear.description: The Composite Spear is an upgrade to the Titanium Spear that deals more damage and is cheaper to craft once Composites can be crafted. Despite Composites being a hefty tech investment, the Composite Spear has the highest damage output and durability outside of Prometheus exclusive Spears. Unlike the Composite Javelin , the Composite Spear cannot be thrown.

Frag Grenade.name: Frag Grenade
Frag Grenade.description: An explosive weapon thrown by hand. Hold left click to charge a throw. The grenade timer starts when the grenade leaves your hand and will take a few seconds to detonate. Stacks up to 5.
Frag Grenade.crafted_at: the Machining Bench with the following resources:

base_recipe.crafted_at: the Machining Bench with the following resources:

Inaris \"Agua\" Spear.name: Inaris "Agua" Spear
Inaris \"Agua\" Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Agua" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no Workshop Javelins .

Inaris \"Cerulean\" Knife.name: Inaris "Cerulean" Knife
Inaris \"Cerulean\" Knife.description: The Inaris "Cerulean" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing frost damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Inaris "Cerulean" Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshop Throwing Knives .

Inaris \"Claret\" Pickaxe.name: Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe
Inaris \"Claret\" Pickaxe.description: The Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing fire damage to targets. Since the Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe has the same mining radius and yield as the Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe , Prospectors are better off using the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe for mining.

Inaris \"Cobalt\" Spear.name: Inaris "Cobalt" Spear
Inaris \"Cobalt\" Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Cobalt" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no Workshop Javelins .

Inaris \"Crimson\" Knife.name: Inaris "Crimson" Knife
Inaris \"Crimson\" Knife.description: The Inaris "Crimson" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing fire damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. Despite what the flavor text says, the Inaris "Crimson" Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no workshop Throwing Knives .

Inaris \"Dawn\" Axe.name: Inaris "Dawn" Axe
Inaris \"Dawn\" Axe.description: The Inaris "Dawn" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing Fire damage to targets. Ideally used with the Berserker talent, which increases axe melee damage.

Inaris \"Dias\" Axe.name: Inaris "Dias" Axe
Inaris \"Dias\" Axe.description: The Inaris "Dias" Axe is the Workshop equivalent of an Steel Axe , allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees. Unlike other Axes , the Inaris "Dias" Axe is the only Axe that lowers the carry weight of wood by 50% when equipped, making it a valuable tool when transporting wood when paired with the Gatherer's Backpack .

Inaris \"Dusk\" Spear.name: Inaris "Dusk" Spear
Inaris \"Dusk\" Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Dusk" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no Workshop Javelins .

Inaris \"Ersa\" Axe.name: Inaris "Ersa" Axe
Inaris \"Ersa\" Axe.description: The Inaris "Ersa" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing Frost damage to targets. Ideally used with the Berserker talent, which increases axe melee damage.

Inaris \"Gris\" Spear.name: Inaris "Gris" Spear
Inaris \"Gris\" Spear.description: The Inaris "Gris" Spear is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Inaris \"Neves\" Pickaxe.name: Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe
Inaris \"Neves\" Pickaxe.description: The Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of a Titanium Pickaxe , allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals ( Aluminium Ore , Platinum Ore , etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while greatly increasing yield. Unlike other pickaxes, the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe is the only pickaxe that reduces the over-encumbrance penalty by 50% when equipped, which makes mobility while over-encumbered bearable when paired with the talent Carry On and Mass Dampener Module s.

Inaris \"Night\" Pickaxe.name: Inaris "Night" Pickaxe
Inaris \"Night\" Pickaxe.description: The Inaris "Night" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat and harvesting Noxious Crust . It deals poison damage to targets, a large amount of damage to armor, has a penalty for mining yield, but also produces Noxious Crust that can be cleaned to produce additional Minerals .

Inaris \"Sali\" Axe.name: Inaris "Sali" Axe
Inaris \"Sali\" Axe.description: The Inaris "Sali" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing poison damage to targets and generating Infected Bark when harvesting trees.

Inaris \"Shade\" Knife.name: Inaris "Shade" Knife
Inaris \"Shade\" Knife.description: The Inaris "Shade" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing poison damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Inaris "Shade" Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshop Throwing Knives .

Inaris \"Ventura\" Knife.name: Inaris "Ventura" Knife
Inaris \"Ventura\" Knife.description: Grants immunity to normal wounds while held, making it a useful tool when fighting several wolves simultaneously. Does not prevent Deep Wounds . Unlike Throwing Knives , the Inaris "Ventura" Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Inaris \"Viridian\" Pickaxe.name: Inaris "Viridian" Pickaxe
Inaris \"Viridian\" Pickaxe.description: The Inaris "Viridian" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing frost damage to targets.

Iron Axe.name: Iron Axe
Iron Axe.description: The Iron Axe is the 2nd axe you will unlock during your time on Icarus. It is located at the bottom of the Tier 2  tech tree, right after the Anvil Bench .

Iron Hammer.name: Iron Hammer
Iron Hammer.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

Iron Knife.name: Iron Knife
Iron Knife.description: The Iron Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from the Bone Knife , the Iron Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. It is also the first knife capable of skinning larger fauna such as the Grizzly Bear and Buffalo . An attachment slot is available, allowing for the application of Tool Attachment Packs at an Alteration Bench / Advanced Alteration Bench .

Iron Pickaxe.name: Iron Pickaxe
Iron Pickaxe.description: The Iron Pickaxe is the 2nd pickaxe prospectors can unlock during their time on Icarus. The blueprint is located at the bottom of the tier 2 tech tree and is considerably better than the previous Stone Pickaxe , granting a 125% boost to mining efficiency. Like all iron tools, the iron pickaxe is repairable at an Anvil Bench .

Iron Sledgehammer.name: Iron Sledgehammer
Iron Sledgehammer.description: Iron Sledgehammer is a Tier 2  Sledgehammer made with Iron .

Iron Spear.name: Iron Spear
Iron Spear.description: The Iron Spear is the first Spear available to prospectors once they reach Tier 2  and serves as an upgrade to its Tier 1  counterparts. Unlike the Iron Javelin , the Iron Spear cannot be thrown.

Iron Throwing Knife.name: Iron Throwing Knife
Iron Throwing Knife.description: The Iron Throwing Knife is a variant of the Iron Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Iron Knife , the Iron Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Larkwell Martinez Axe.name: Larkwell Martinez Axe
Larkwell Martinez Axe.description: The Larkwell Martinez Axe is the Workshop equivalent of an Steel Axe , allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees. Similar to the Inaris "Dias" Axe , the Larkwell Martinez Axe also reduces the carry weight of wood when equipped.

Larkwell Martinez Hammer.name: Larkwell Martinez Hammer
Larkwell Martinez Hammer.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

Larkwell Martinez Knife.name: Larkwell Martinez Knife
Larkwell Martinez Knife.description: The Larkwell Martinez Knife is the hardest-hitting Workshop knife available. Unlike Throwing Knives , the Larkwell Martinez Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe.name: Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe
Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe.description: The Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of a Platinum Pickaxe , allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals ( Aluminium Ore , Platinum Ore , etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield. Similar to the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe , the Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe reduces the over-encumbrance penalty by 10% when equipped.

Larkwell Martinez Spear.name: Larkwell Martinez Spear
Larkwell Martinez Spear.description: The Larkwell Martinez Spear is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Machete.name: Machete
Machete.description: The Machete is a Tool that can be used to skin Fauna and harvest Carrots, Wheat, shrubbery, etc. similar to Sickles .

Miasmic Axe.name: Miasmic Axe
Miasmic Axe.description: Miasmic Axe is a Tier 4  Axe made with Distilled Miasmic Coating derived from Crystallized Miasma found in the Swamps on Prometheus . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Miasmic Knife.name: Miasmic Knife
Miasmic Knife.description: Miasmic Knife is a Tier 4  Knife made with Distilled Miasmic Coating derived from Crystallized Miasma found in the Swamps on Prometheus . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Miasmic Pickaxe.name: Miasmic Pickaxe
Miasmic Pickaxe.description: Miasmic Pickaxe is a Tier 4  Pickaxe made with Distilled Miasmic Coating derived from Crystallized Miasma found in the Swamps on Prometheus . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Miasmic Sledgehammer.name: Miasmic Sledgehammer
Miasmic Sledgehammer.description: Miasmic Sledgehammer is a Tier 4  Sledgehammer made with Distilled Miasmic Coating derived from Crystallized Miasma found in the Swamps on Prometheus . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Miasmic Spear.name: Miasmic Spear
Miasmic Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike the Miasmic Javelin , the Miasmic Spear cannot be thrown.

Miasmic Throwing Knife.name: Miasmic Throwing Knife
Miasmic Throwing Knife.description: The Miasmic Throwing Knife is a variant of the Miasmic Knife that can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching the Miasmic Knife . Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

MXC Axe.name: MXC Axe
MXC Axe.description: The MXC Axe is the Workshop equivalent of a Stone Axe , providing a minor boost to felling damage and yield.

MXC Hammer.name: MXC Hammer
MXC Hammer.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

MXC Knife.name: MXC Knife
MXC Knife.description: The MXC Knife is equivalent to Tier 2  Tech like the Iron Knife , giving Prospectors the ability to skin larger animals, such as Buffalo and Grizzly Bears . Unlike Throwing Knives , the MXC Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

MXC Pickaxe.name: MXC Pickaxe
MXC Pickaxe.description: The MXC Pickaxe is the workshop equivalent of a Stone Pickaxe , providing a minor boost to mining yield and efficiency.

MXC Spear.name: MXC Spear
MXC Spear.description: The MXC Spear is the first Spear that can be unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Obsidian Sledgehammer.name: Obsidian Sledgehammer
Obsidian Sledgehammer.description: Obsidian Sledgehammer is a Tier 2  Sledgehammer made with Shaped Obsidian . Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Obsidian Spear.name: Obsidian Spear
Obsidian Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike the Obsidian Javelin , the Obsidian Spear cannot be thrown.

Obsidian Throwing Knife.name: Obsidian Throwing Knife
Obsidian Throwing Knife.description: The Obsidian Throwing Knife is a variant of the Obsidian Knife that can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching the Obsidian Knife . Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Platinum Axe.name: Platinum Axe
Platinum Axe.description: The Platinum Axe is a mid/late-game Axe that can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

Platinum Hammer.name: Platinum Hammer
Platinum Hammer.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

Platinum Knife.name: Platinum Knife
Platinum Knife.description: The Platinum Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from the Steel Knife , the Platinum Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. Unlike the Platinum Throwing Knife , the Platinum Knife cannot be thrown.

Platinum Pickaxe.name: Platinum Pickaxe
Platinum Pickaxe.description: The Platinum Pickaxe is a mid/late-game Pickaxe that can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

Platinum Spear.name: Platinum Spear
Platinum Spear.description: The Platinum Spear is the first Spear available to prospectors once they reach Tier 3  and serves as an, albeit expensive, upgrade to its Tier 2  counterparts. Unlike the Platinum Javelin , the Platinum Spear cannot be thrown.

Platinum Throwing Knife.name: Platinum Throwing Knife
Platinum Throwing Knife.description: The Platinum Throwing Knife is a variant of the Platinum Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Platinum Knife , the Platinum Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Sandworm Knife.name: Sandworm Knife
Sandworm Knife.description: The Sandworm Knife is made with scales obtained from Sandworms . Considering the Sandworm Knife deals the same amount of damage as a Steel Knife , the Sandworm Knife is overshadowed by higher-tier knives and is not worth the effort.

Sandworm Spear.name: Sandworm Spear
Sandworm Spear.description: The Sandworm Spear is made with scales from Sandworms and can be used for melee combat with reach. Considering the Sandworm Spear deals the same amount of damage as a Bone Spear , the Sandworm Spear is overshadowed by higher-tier spears and currently not worth the effort.

Sandworm Throwing Knife.name: Sandworm Throwing Knife
Sandworm Throwing Knife.description: The Sandworm Throwing Knife is a variant of the Sandworm Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Sandworm Knife , the Sandworm Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Shengong \"Akira\" Hammer.name: Shengong "Akira" Hammer
Shengong \"Akira\" Hammer.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

Shengong CY7 Axe.name: Shengong CY7 Axe
Shengong CY7 Axe.description: The Shengong CY7 Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with the chance to significantly hinder targets. Ideally used with the Berserker talent, which increases axe melee damage.

Shengong \"Daokou\" Knife.name: Shengong "Daokou" Knife
Shengong \"Daokou\" Knife.description: The Shengong "Daokou" Knife is equivalent to Tier 2  Tech like the Iron Knife , giving Prospectors the ability to skin larger animals, such as Buffalo and Grizzly Bears . Unlike Throwing Knives , the Shengong "Daokou" Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Shengong \"Dida\" Spear.name: Shengong "Dida" Spear
Shengong \"Dida\" Spear.description: The Shengong "Dida" Spear is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Shengong DL7 Knife.name: Shengong DL7 Knife
Shengong DL7 Knife.description: The Shengong DL7 Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with a chance to significantly hinder targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Shengong DL7 Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshop Throwing Knives .

Shengong \"Dong\" Pickaxe.name: Shengong "Dong" Pickaxe
Shengong \"Dong\" Pickaxe.description: The Shengong "Dong" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of a Steel Pickaxe , allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals ( Aluminium Ore , Platinum Ore , etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

Shengong \"Gong Bu\" Spear.name: Shengong "Gong Bu" Spear
Shengong \"Gong Bu\" Spear.description: The Shengong "Gong Bu" Spear is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Shengong \"Heike\" Axe.name: Shengong "Heike" Axe
Shengong \"Heike\" Axe.description: The Shengong "Heike" Axe is the Workshop equivalent of an Iron Axe , allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees.

Shengong \"Jiju\" Spear.name: Shengong "Jiju" Spear
Shengong \"Jiju\" Spear.description: The Shengong "Jiju" Spear is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Shengong \"Jushi\" Pickaxe.name: Shengong "Jushi" Pickaxe
Shengong \"Jushi\" Pickaxe.description: The Shengong "Jushi" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of a Steel Pickaxe , allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals ( Aluminium Ore , Platinum Ore , etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

Shengong \"Kuang\" Pickaxe.name: Shengong "Kuang" Pickaxe
Shengong \"Kuang\" Pickaxe.description: The Shengong "Kuang" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of a Steel Pickaxe , allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals ( Aluminium Ore , Platinum Ore , etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

Shengong 'Lie' Axe.name: Shengong 'Lie' Axe
Shengong 'Lie' Axe.description: The Shengong 'Lie' Axe is the Workshop equivalent of an Iron Axe , allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees.

Shengong PF1 Spear.name: Shengong PF1 Spear
Shengong PF1 Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Shengong PF1 Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no Workshop Javelins .

Shengong 'Qie' Knife.name: Shengong 'Qie' Knife
Shengong 'Qie' Knife.description: This knife and others, such as the Shengong 'Sichou' Knife , with the additional attribute that gives increased skinning yield actually has a 230% Yield from Skinning. This is because the additional attribute is multiplicative and not additive, making them better than the Titanium Knife or Inaris "Ventura" Knife at skinning. Unlike Throwing Knives , the Shengong 'Qie' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Shengong 'Sen' Axe.name: Shengong 'Sen' Axe
Shengong 'Sen' Axe.description: The Shengong 'Sen' Axe is the Workshop equivalent of an Iron Axe , allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees.

Shengong 'Shui' Knife.name: Shengong 'Shui' Knife
Shengong 'Shui' Knife.description: The Shengong 'Shui' Knife is equivalent to Tier 2  Tech like the Iron Knife , giving Prospectors the ability to skin larger animals, such as Buffalo and Grizzly Bears . Unlike Throwing Knives , the Shengong 'Shui' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Shengong 'Sichou' Knife.name: Shengong 'Sichou' Knife
Shengong 'Sichou' Knife.description: This knife and others, such as the Shengong 'Qie' Knife , with the additional attribute that gives increased skinning yield actually has a 230% Yield from Skinning. This is because the additional attribute is multiplicative and not additive, making them better than the Titanium Knife or Inaris "Ventura" Knife at skinning. Unlike Throwing Knives , the Shengong 'Sichou' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe.name: Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe
Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe.description: The Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of a Steel Pickaxe , allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals ( Aluminium Ore , Platinum Ore , etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

Shengong 'Tetsuo' Hammer.name: Shengong 'Tetsuo' Hammer
Shengong 'Tetsuo' Hammer.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

Shengong UT5 Pickaxe.name: Shengong UT5 Pickaxe
Shengong UT5 Pickaxe.description: The Shengong UT5 Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with the chance to significantly hinder targets. Since the Shengong UT5 Pickaxe has the same mining radius and yield as the Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe , Prospectors are better off using the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe for mining.

Shengong \"Xingxing\" Spear.name: Shengong "Xingxing" Spear
Shengong \"Xingxing\" Spear.description: The Shengong "Xingxing" Spear is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station and is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Smoke Grenade.name: Smoke Grenade
Smoke Grenade.description: A smoke grenade is a canister-type grenade used as a signaling device, target or landing zone marking device, or as a screening device for unit movements. Upon detonation, the Smoke Grenade will cover the area in smoke and will obstruct the vision of creatures within the smoke. However, it will not stop creatures that are already aggressively pursuing Prospectors, creatures spawned by Thumpers, Radars, or other mission items that have been placed or activated. Stacks up to 5.

Steel Axe.name: Steel Axe
Steel Axe.description: The Steel Axe is a mid-game Tool available in Icarus. Prospectors can unlock it in Tier 2  of the Tech Tree , after reaching Level 20.

Steel Hammer.name: Steel Hammer
Steel Hammer.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

Steel Knife.name: Steel Knife
Steel Knife.description: The Steel Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from the Iron Knife , the Steel Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. An attachment slot is available, allowing for the application of Tool Attachment Packs at an Alteration Bench / Advanced Alteration Bench .

Steel Pickaxe.name: Steel Pickaxe
Steel Pickaxe.description: The Steel pickaxe is the 3rd pickaxe prospectors can unlock during your time on Icarus and allows for the mining of denser Minerals not obtainable with the Iron Pickaxe or Stone Pickaxe . Like iron tools, the steel pickaxe is made and is repairable at an Anvil Bench .

Steel Spear.name: Steel Spear
Steel Spear.description: The Steel Spear is an upgrade to the Iron Spear that deals more damage/critical damage to targets and has twice the durability. Unlike the Steel Javelin , the Steel Spear cannot be thrown.

Steel Throwing Knife.name: Steel Throwing Knife
Steel Throwing Knife.description: The Steel Throwing Knife is a variant of the Steel Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Steel Knife , the Steel Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Stone Axe.name: Stone Axe
Stone Axe.description: The Stone Axe is used primarily for chopping down trees and Small Trees , reducing them to usable Wood . In the process of chopping apart fallen trees, a small number of Sticks may be added to your inventory automatically.

Stone Knife.name: Stone Knife
Stone Knife.description: The first knife that can be unlocked, the Stone Knife is a fast melee weapon and doubles as a tool with any knife being necessary to skin a carcass prior to unlocking the Skinning Bench .

Stone Throwing Knife.name: Stone Throwing Knife
Stone Throwing Knife.description: The Stone Throwing Knife is a variant of the Stone Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Stone Knife , the Stone Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of 5 and stacks up to fifty.

Taxidermy Knife.name: Taxidermy Knife
Taxidermy Knife.description: The Taxidermy Knife is used for skinning Fauna carcasses, when a prospector wishes to obtain a Vestige for mounting. Skinning any carcass with a taxidermy knife grants four Bestiary points for the animal skinned.

Titanium Axe.name: Titanium Axe
Titanium Axe.description: The Titanium Axe is the highest tiered Axe that can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

Titanium Hammer.name: Titanium Hammer
Titanium Hammer.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

Titanium Knife.name: Titanium Knife
Titanium Knife.description: The Titanium Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from the Platinum Knife , the Titanium Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. Unlike the Titanium Throwing Knife , the Titanium Knife cannot be thrown.

Titanium Pickaxe.name: Titanium Pickaxe
Titanium Pickaxe.description: The Titanium Pickaxe is the highest-tiered Pickaxe that can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus. When combined with a Tool Attachment Pack / Advanced Tool Attachment Pack , the Titanium Pickaxe surpasses the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe in terms of mining.

Titanium Spear.name: Titanium Spear
Titanium Spear.description: The Titanium Spear is the first Spear available to prospectors once they reach Tier 4  and serves as an, albeit expensive, upgrade to its Tier 3  counterparts. Unlike the Titanium Javelin , the Titanium Spear cannot be thrown.

Titanium Throwing Knife.name: Titanium Throwing Knife
Titanium Throwing Knife.description: The Titanium Throwing Knife is a variant of the Titanium Knife that can be thrown. Unlike the Titanium Knife , the Titanium Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Wood Hammer.name: Wood Hammer
Wood Hammer.description: Example: If a Prospector were to upgrade a Wood Wall to a Stone Wall , a Stone Wall must be in the inventory of the Prospector when upgrading.

Wood Spear.name: Wood Spear
Wood Spear.description: The Wood Spear is the first Spear available to prospectors and serves as an alternative to the Stone Knife , dealing increased critical damage but with a slower attack speed. Like other spears, the Wood Spear increase the range to which prospectors can attack fauna, providing a unique advantage when up high.

Advanced Pistol.name: Advanced Pistol
Advanced Pistol.description: The Advanced Pistol is the most advanced Tier 4  handgun with the largest ammo capacity, durability and rate of fire. It fires Pistol Ammunition such as Armor Piercing , Explosive , Incendiary , Obsidian or regular 9mm Rounds .

Anti-materiel Rifle.name: Anti-materiel Rifle
Anti-materiel Rifle.description: The Anti-materiel Rifle is a bolt-action, anti-materiel rifle with a long effective range and an included scope for viewing the target. It fires Sniper Ammunition purchased from the Workshop .

Assault Rifle.name: Assault Rifle
Assault Rifle.description: The Assault Rifle is an automatic firearm with reduced critical damage, +15 round ammo capacity and a high rate of fire. It uses Assault Rifle Ammunition such as Armor Piercing , Explosive , Incendiary , Obsidian or regular 5.56mm Rounds .

Automated Defense System: Pistol.name: Automated Defense System: Pistol
Automated Defense System: Pistol.description: Automated Defense System: Pistol is a deployable base defense turret that fires Pistol Ammunition at hostile Fauna .

Bolt Action Rifle.name: Bolt Action Rifle
Bolt Action Rifle.description: The Bolt Action Rifle is the first long-range Firearm that prospectors can create. It can utilize the 7.62mm Round , the Incendiary Rifle Round , etc. Along with the Shotgun , it provides Prospectors with a significant increase in survivability when encountering the Fauna of Icarus. The Bolt Action Rifle can fire 75 rounds before breaking, and the talent Gunsmith can increase this to up to a maximum of 90 rounds, so bring a Machining Bench for long trips.

Caveworm Bow.name: Caveworm Bow
Caveworm Bow.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows, the Caveworm Bow is harder hitting than the Longbow and is equal in strength to the Recurve Bow .

CHAC \"Sentinel\" Pistol.name: CHAC "Sentinel" Pistol
CHAC \"Sentinel\" Pistol.description: The CHAC "Sentinel" Pistol is an advanced handgun with increased projectile and critical damage that is comparable, or better than other Tier 4  Firearms .

Compound Bow.name: Compound Bow
Compound Bow.description: The tail-end of the 20th Century brought about many advancements in technology and archery didn't get left behind. A Compound Bow works like a simple block and tackle, multiplying input energy over distance with it's Cam and Idler Wheel pulleys, instead of traditional bow limbs; which allows the Compound Bow to hit harder than the Recurve Bow .

Crossbow.name: Crossbow
Crossbow.description: The earliest known Crossbows were invented on Earth in the first millennium BC, not later than the 7th century BC in ancient China, not later than the 1st century AD in Greece; on Icarus, Prospectors will test this ancient technology in many challenges to see if it still holds up.

Gunpowder.name: Gunpowder
Gunpowder.description: Gunpowder is a precursor resource used in making Ammunition , weapons like the Frag Grenade , and Volatile Substance .

Hunting Rifle.name: Hunting Rifle
Hunting Rifle.description: An attachment slot is available, allowing for the application of Ranged Attachment Packs at an Alteration Bench / Advanced Alteration Bench .

Inaris \"Heavy\" Crossbow.name: Inaris "Heavy" Crossbow
Inaris \"Heavy\" Crossbow.description: The Inaris "Heavy" Crossbow is the opposite of the Inaris "Rapid" Crossbow , trading reload speed for a significant boost to overall damage. The Inaris "Heavy" Crossbow can use Crossbow Bolts crafted on planet as well as Bolts crafted in the Workshop .

Inaris \"Lune\" Crossbow.name: Inaris "Lune" Crossbow
Inaris \"Lune\" Crossbow.description: The Inaris "Lune" Crossbow can use Crossbow Bolts crafted on planet as well as Workshop Bolts . Firing faster and dealing more damage than its predecessors, the Inaris "Lune" Crossbow, as a whole, is a must for avid Crossbow users.

Inaris \"Rapid\" Crossbow.name: Inaris "Rapid" Crossbow
Inaris \"Rapid\" Crossbow.description: The Inaris "Rapid" Crossbow is unlocked in the Workshop on the Space Station . The Inaris "Rapid" Crossbow can use crossbow bolts crafted on planet as well as the bolts crafted in the Workshop .

Inaris \"Sole\" Crossbow.name: Inaris "Sole" Crossbow
Inaris \"Sole\" Crossbow.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with other crossbows, the Inaris "Sole" Crossbow is geared more towards elemental damage. When paired with Bolts that deal elemental damage ( Obsidian Bolts , Larkwell Martinez Charged Bolts , etc), the Inaris "Sole" Crossbow can pack a punch, making it a decent, if not expensive, upgrade to the previous Workshop Crossbows. Dealt elemental damage is not affected by Crossbow talents.

Kinetic Rifle.name: Kinetic Rifle
Kinetic Rifle.description: The Kinetic Rifle is a Legendary Weapon Rifle that can be purchased at the Bio-lab .

Larkwell Martinez Compound Bow.name: Larkwell Martinez Compound Bow
Larkwell Martinez Compound Bow.description: The Larkwell Martinez Compound Bow is a stronger, more durable variant of the Compound Bow using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

Longbow.name: Longbow
Longbow.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with other Bows , the Longbow hits harder than the Wood Bow .

One-Shot Pistol.name: One-Shot Pistol
One-Shot Pistol.description: The One-Shot Pistol is an inexpensive early-game Tier 2  handgun that holds one bullet.

Pistol.name: Pistol
Pistol.description: The Pistol is a single-shot 9mm handgun and is a decent upgrade in firepower available to prospectors. It fires 35 rounds of Pistol Ammunition before breaking, so bring a Machining Bench / Repair Bench for long trips.

Platinum Crossbow.name: Platinum Crossbow
Platinum Crossbow.description: The Platinum Crossbow is a mid/late game weapon that can penetrate hardened points with a chance to slow targets but has a slower fire rate than Bows .

Recurve Bow.name: Recurve Bow
Recurve Bow.description: The pinnacle of Instinctive Archery, made of Steel and Aluminium , the Recurve Bow hits harder than the Longbow .

Rusty Shotgun.name: Rusty Shotgun
Rusty Shotgun.description: A crude version of the Shotgun that fires slower and holds fewer rounds. It uses any type of Shotgun Ammunition .

Sandworm Bow.name: Sandworm Bow
Sandworm Bow.description: The Sandworm Bow is made with scales from the Sandworm , using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

Semi-Automatic Pistol.name: Semi-Automatic Pistol
Semi-Automatic Pistol.description: The Semi-Automatic Pistol is a Tier 3  handgun with more ammo capacity than the Pistol . It fires pistol Pistol Ammunition such as Armor Piercing , Explosive , Incendiary , Obsidian or regular 9mm Rounds .

Shengong CZ4 Bow.name: Shengong CZ4 Bow
Shengong CZ4 Bow.description: Using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows, the Shengong CZ4 Bow is geared more towards elemental damage. When paired with arrows that deal elemental damage ( Obsidian Arrows , Inaris "Netch" Arrows , etc), the Shengong CZ4 Bow can pack a punch, making it a decent, if not expensive, upgrade to the previous Shengong Bows. Dealt elemental damage is not affected by Bow talents.

Shengong HS2 Bow.name: Shengong HS2 Bow
Shengong HS2 Bow.description: The Shengong HS2 Bow is a stronger variant of the Shengong Bows using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows. Despite the Shengong HS2 Bow dealing 35% less damage than the Larkwell Martinez Compound Bow , the Shengong HS2 Bow is unmatched in reload speed and fire rate; perfect for the Prospector who wants to fill the skies with arrows.

Shengong \"Jijing\" Bow.name: Shengong "Jijing" Bow
Shengong \"Jijing\" Bow.description: The Shengong "Jijing" Bow is a stronger, more durable variant of the Recurve Bow using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

Shengong \"Ji\" Bow.name: Shengong "Ji" Bow
Shengong \"Ji\" Bow.description: The Shengong "Ji" Bow is a stronger, more durable variant of the Recurve Bow using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

Shengong \"Zhang Hu\" Bow.name: Shengong "Zhang Hu" Bow
Shengong \"Zhang Hu\" Bow.description: The Shengong "Zhang Hu" Bow is a stronger, more durable variant of the Recurve Bow using arrows and talents interchangeably with other bows.

Shotgun.name: Shotgun
Shotgun.description: The Shotgun is one of the first Firearms available to prospectors. Using 12-Gauge Buckshot Shell for ammunition, the Shotgun is more powerful than the Bolt Action Rifle at close range. However, damage decreases rapidly as range increases, and prospectors should not rely on it for long-range encounters with the Fauna of Icarus. The Shotgun can fire 100 rounds before breaking, and the talent Gunsmith can increase this to up to a maximum of 125 rounds, so bring a Machining Bench for long trips.

Submachine Gun.name: Submachine Gun
Submachine Gun.description: The Submachine Gun is a compact firearm with low projectile and critical damage, but a high rate of fire. It uses Pistol Ammunition such as Armor Piercing , Explosive , Incendiary , Obsidian or regular 9mm Rounds .

Tactical Bow.name: Tactical Bow
Tactical Bow.description: The Tactical Bow is an advanced bow that is part of the Great Hunts Campaigns DLC on Prometheus . It fires any type of Arrow and can be upgraded in the Bio-lab .

Titanium Crossbow.name: Titanium Crossbow
Titanium Crossbow.description: The Titanium Crossbow is an upgrade to the Platinum Crossbow that offers a boost to projectile damage and a slightly larger ammo count; has a chance to slow targets and can fully penetrate hardened points, but has a slower fire rate than Bows .

Tomato & Egg Bowl.name: Tomato & Egg Bowl
Tomato & Egg Bowl.description: Tomato & Egg Bowl is a Food with a unique Status Effect , which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfy Hunger .

Trench Shotgun.name: Trench Shotgun
Trench Shotgun.description: An attachment slot is available, allowing for the application of Ranged Attachment Packs at an Alteration Bench / Advanced Alteration Bench . Devastating up close when paired with the Barrel Widening Attachment / Narrow Barrel Attachment s and the Larkwell Martinez Mercenary Backpack .

Wood Bow.name: Wood Bow
Wood Bow.description: The Wood Bow is the first bow a player can get access to. It can be unlocked via the Tech Tree in Tier 1  with no prerequisite tech required.
